Reviews.Title: “poor finishings”
Reviews.Author: JarrodD4
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 45th floor. great location and view, nice room. 2 bedroom with oodles of space. Stayed for 6 nights, really noisy on the weekend, as if the front door was made of paper and lots of city noise, thumping from night clubs the towel rails fell off the wall when i went to hang a towel, the tap fell off into the bath and the plaster was falling out of the ceiling above the sliding glass door to the veranda and the locking drop pins were locked half way down and no key so they were very difficult to open and scraped along the bottom when you tried to open and close them. House keeping did not clean very well, the bath was filthy, they cleaned the floor once the whole time we were there. bedroom window sill so dusty right above the pillows. expensive internet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific apartment and great view!”
Reviews.Author: GostateFlushing
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment on the 40th floor. The apartment was spacious, modern and clean. 2 full baths were a bonus. Location was in China town, but wasn't too noisy (maybe because we were on such a high floor). Hot tub wasnt very hot, but the room had an extra large tub. Great city location. Great view from balcony. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & views of the city”
Reviews.Author: saramog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 5 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment. My daughter & myself had the larger bedroom with en-suite while my Mum had a twin room with bathroom next door. The apartment was large & clean, the only down side was that the oven hadn't been cleaned & there was food still left in it! But apart from that the kitchen was very adequate & well equiped. We made full use of the washing machine & dryer & cooked basic meals. It was cleaned every day & the views from our balconly were amazing! But bit scary if you have children. The wall were quite thin & you could hear noises from adjacent apartments & the doors do tend to slam shut but apart from that would definately recommend this as an alternative to a hotel as the location was very good. We were close to the monorail & the harbour was about a steady 15 minute walk. There are loads of shopping malls nearby. All in all we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best 2 bedroom accomodation in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Marylou66
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the 2 bedroom apartment. There were 4 of us and we all had single beds which was great. Price was good and rooms were great. Very spacious. One room also had an ensuite and a TV. At night from the lounge you could see the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Luna Park. Everyone was very friendly. the rooms were cleaned daily. Location was also very good as close to city and monorail was right there.

Reviews.Title: “stunning apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: Mark27dublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 Nights (late February till March 5th) We ordered a 1 bedroom apartment, but we ended up getting a 2 bedroom apartment (second bedroom was locked) which means we had a lot more space, our friend stayed in a hotel nearby but came over every evening for drinks and sometimes dinner. our room could've been cleaned every day, however we were quite tidy, so we told them it wasn't needed. I will deffinately use Meriton again as it is a lot better than hotels in that you can buy your own drinks and cook your own food (saved us a lot of money) Bedroom was really clean and bright, same for the bathroom which had a bath and seperate shower. The living room was huge, everything you'd want if you would have your apartment in Sydney. Kitchen also had everything you would need to make yourself comfortable. all in all, we had an amazing time here

Reviews.Title: “Not so Merry Meriton Apartment !”
Reviews.Author: Lana C
Reviews.Content: I checked into a studio apartment for 12 nights stay with some friends who had the 2 bedroom apartment.The check in was quite efficient as we arrived early and the check in time was 2pm and my friend 's room was ready.I went into my friend's apartment whilst I waited for my room to be ready.I did not have to wait too long and the reception called to say my room was ready.A polite man came up with the keys and help me with my luggage to my studio apartment, The studio was of decent size with a double bed,small kitchenette,washing machine with dryer and a small bathroom without bath except a shower with slow running water(something about saving water,eco-friendly) so if you have long hair forget about washing your hair in the shower, it will take ages! go to a nearby hair salon! I found it rather strange that the more nights you stay in this apartment the less service you get! In most hotels the more nights you booked they give you more service.I have to be fair about the comments re the cleaning services, when i booked direct to the Apartment they did say cleaning only on the 7th day after you check in,luckily I am quite a tidy person. I enquired on the 3rd dayif they would clean my room, and i was spoken to by a very rude (Chinese) girl, without a name badge, behind the reception saying in a very rude tone that I had not read the contract which I had signed which stated that the room would only be cleaned on the 7th day.! This girl should not be working in the front office with such bad PR. If I have known I would not have taken the studio as I could stay in the Grace hotel nearby for about the same price and with breakfast, and with room cleaning every day. Special mention must be given to the duty manager Henry who was very polite and knowlegable about Sydney. Do seek him out if you need any help. The corridors to your apartment are quite narrow and dingy. Sound proofing of the doors is quite bad as you can hear the sound quite clearly when someone open and close their doors.By the way the airconditioning has been programmed to switch off automaticaly after 4 hours, so in the middle of the night you will wake up sweating. So you have to get out of your bed to switch on the aircon again if you want to be cool . The whole place looks rather run down and tired ! Definately would not stay in this apartment again. You can get better value for money elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: rldot1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights whilst my husband was on business in Sydney. We were accompanied by our 14 month old son. We were allocated a 2 bedroom apartment as we needed a bath for our son. We occupied the master bedroom and used the ensuite next to it which had a bath. The other bedroom and the other bathroom were locked. Undercover parking was available and easily accessed. We did not pay for the stay so I cannot comment on value for money. The hotel is located right in the middle of the CBD, only a block or so from the Pitt Street Mall. It is surrounded by shops, restaurants, pharmacies, supermarkets, bottle shops, in short, everything you could ever possibly need. The room was well furnished and had the best stocked kitchen of any hotel I have ever stayed in. There were floor to ceiling windows which offered spectacular views of the city. My son could not stop looking out of them. There was plenty of room for all of us and we enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: EtheB
Reviews.Content: Check-in was painless enough although the $300 deposit hold on the credit card was a bit unusual. The lifts? - ok so all tall buildings are going involve waiting for lifts but these seemed extra painful and slower then most. Most trips in & out involved 10+ min just waiting around for a lift - Early morning and mid arvo were worse. Studio room was smaller than expected and poorly laid out - power points were in some strange places. Bathroom was small but functional, as was the kichenette, and cupboard laundry was good. Queen bed was actually two singles pushed together - usually ok but these had the habit of drifting apart. Pitt st location convenient and room was quiet once the window was closed. Air con had annoying feature of switching off after 4 hours which generally meant waking mid-morning to a stuffy room. A bit of a mixed bag overall and can't say I'd stay again. Overall - ok.

Reviews.Title: “great value!”
Reviews.Author: anonymous_momdoc
Reviews.Content: Spacious! Great for families at the same cost a single hotel room! Same block as supermarket and train station. At the heart of downtown so monorail, bus and hop on hop off tour stops very near plus a lot of great shops!

Reviews.Title: “Average serviced apartments on Pitt street”
Reviews.Author: LindsayCheshire
Reviews.Content: First impressions were of the lifts taking some time to arrive and once inside became very stuffy, very quickly. Allocated an apartment on 39th floor ( given 2 bedroomed although paid for one bedroomed) so it was spacious and convenient to have use of two bathrooms. Plenty of toiletries and towels. Unfortunately the standard of the deep cleaning ie Inbetween guests needs review as on closer inspection the oven hadn't seen a proper clean for some time and inside wardrobes needed cleaning. Apartments are showing signs of wear and tear and this is a shame. The biggest problem for us however was the street noise as we could hear cars until 3/4am ( on the 39th floor!) particularly weekend nights. If staying again in Sydney I wouldn't stay in CBD area again, better option is to stay elsewhere and use trains to get to harbour and shopping districts. Also a warning to those paying the reception for the shuttle bus to airport. We paid 14 dollars per person for one way and given voucher. Unfortunately unbeknown to us there are several shuttle buses providing the service. We travelled with 6 other guests to the airport and it wasn't until we arrived that the driver created a bit of a fuss because we had unintentionally travelled on the wrong shuttle! He obviously wasnt the shuttle service the reception staff had booked on our behalf but we hadn't realised this. This guy wanted another ten dollars each but we refused and told him to refer to the meriton apartments but it put a dampner on our experience of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value at great location”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: This property was a block from Hyde Park, a half-block from the subway (two stops to Circular Quay), a half-block from grocery store and surrounded by coffee houses and restaurants. Area looks a little scruffy in places, but the large crowds of workers and tourists made it more than safe and acceptable. And there's really high-end shopping within a block, too, if you must spend all the money you save staying here. We had suite with two balconies (one covered), kitchen and washer/dryer on 42nd floor. Great views. Really good help from desk staff with questions etc. Beyond all the above benefits, the place was reasonably priced for downtown Sydney with easy access to all the good stuff! Only issue we had was that the cab we ordered through front desk did not appear on time and we had to flag one down ourselves in order not to miss our flight. Minor issue during a great stay. We'd go back in a minute if we return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need good location”
Reviews.Author: ianandalli
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Booking.com and managed to get a good deal. We stayed in a studio apartment which was great just for the two of us. Very compact room but had everything we need. Small well equipped kitchen, tiny bathroom but very functional, good laundry facitlities, very, very comfortable bed with TV with a good selection of channels. The room was clean but smelt of smoke eventhough it was supposedly non smoking. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great location and very close to Museum Station. Only negative comment I would have was that the Front Office was very understaffed. We had to wait a long time to check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and apartment”
Reviews.Author: hilts1773
Reviews.Content: This building is in a great location, just down the road from Darling harbour, and 10 minutes walk from the bridge, Opera house, and botanical gardens. The apartment was very modern with everything you would expect from a serviced apartment. The pool is a good size and the gym has all you need to keep things ticking over. All in all - Highy recommended.

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking view and great location”
Reviews.Author: Cindy L
Reviews.Content: Super value for money With their great location and their serviced apartment is spacious, clean and neat, which includes kitchenette, washing machine, dryer, a living room, a dining table, big enough to sit 6 people. Strongly recommend this hotel if you are travelling as a group! Woolworth is also just behind the hotel (near the station) George street is also just around the corner. Their utensils, pots and pans, kettle, toaster, you name it they have it! They even have a oven for you to heat up your food. You can have your own breakfast with toasted bread and jam with hot tea and we even managed to cook simple dinner in the hotel. Simply a 5 star experience!

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm A
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a spacious, well appointed two bedroomed apartment for a happy two week stay during which we found the elevators efficient, staff very helpful and the location superb. The apartment was very well equipped with everything we needed providing a great home from home at exceptionally good value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: nzwccw
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms and facilities, nothing much for me to criticize. If you have a few people to share an apartment to share the costs, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - noisy on the weekend.”
Reviews.Author: QMochalatte
Reviews.Content: My better half and I spent 6 nights here on a recent trip to Sydney. We had a one bedroom apartment which was spacious, clean and had everything you could need. A good value option for Sydney in a fantastic central location close to buses and Town Hall station. A couple of glitches though: On the weekends the noise from the street does get a bit intense. All the appliances are a little average - if you are a person who needs a hairdryer, bring your own because these are the size of a matchbox car and cut out after 45 seconds. I called for a replacement and the exact same thing happened. OH the bad hair days! At the end of a long day we went to settle in to watch some tv and found ALL the channels fuzzy and the Foxtel channels advertised not there. Again we asked for some assistance (because neither of the remotes worked) and the person assisting us couldn't fix the problem. No biggie really but it's nice to have the option. The iron didn't work either and the ironing board only came up to your knees! And I'm short. Still, the value is terrific compared to hotels, it's just that some of the finer details were overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “good view of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: malbak
Reviews.Content: Very good spacious apartment, washer and dryer a useful bonus in the middle of a touring holiday. Great location , central for all tourist areas, close to Hyde Park. Staff always helpful and no trouble with lifts even at busy times. Balcony too tiny (and scary) but never locked as others have reported.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: BradfordAlex
Reviews.Content: A beautiful clean spacious luxurious apartment , we had two lovely goodsized bathrooms , one with a bath which I wasn't expecting , plus the real added bonus of a washer / dryer . We stopped over a weekend and had no issues with our balcony being locked . I would certainly return and stay here again. A special mention to the guy on reception I'm not sure if he was called Henry or Edward , but he was lovely, very friendly and helpful .

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Perthgirl29
Reviews.Content: Best thing was the central location - short walk to Darling Harbour, Chinatown, Paddy's markets etc. and just round the corner from Town Hall station. We had a one bed apartment on level 22 so no views to speak of, also no balcony. Doors opened to what was literally a space one step wide, so useless. Apartment was clean and the kitchen had everything we needed, including a full sized oven. Washing machine & tumble drier were provided but a clothes airer would also have been useful, we had to improvise with case stand & backs of chairs. We stayed a week & the apartment had a "light" service every day. Bins were emptied, beds made & towels changed if requested. We were forgotten one day but after a quick word to reception it was done later that afternoon. I saw no evidence of any bathroom cleaning all week. The lifts were a bit of a pain at busy times. Being on level 22 they often arrived full on their descent. On saturday evening I had to wait 15 minutes to get a lift going up and on sunday morning when we checked out we had to wait about 10 minutes to get back down with the luggage. There is a luggage storage facility we used on our last day as our flights weren't until late afternoon. Seemed secure as was locked when not staffed. It was quite humid during our stay but the air con was fine and worked well. We had no bath and the shower pressure was low to conserve water. There were bottles of water in the apartment for sale at $3 a small bottle so we didn't bother. There is a Woolworths just by Town Hall station which was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: vessie73
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location! Apartments are spacious and comfortable. Very clean and kitchen is fully equipped so if you wanted to you could cook your meals easily. The bathroom is spacious and a massive bath. Fully equipped laundry also. This is the second Meriton I have stayed at in Sydney and wouldn't hesitate to recommend. I stayed in a 2 bedroom but friends stayed in a 1 bedroom which was just as spacious and well set out. Great sized balconies and outdoor setting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartment Complex in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: XR6PSI
Reviews.Content: I could not believe how good these apartments were for the price, right in the heart of Sydney. I would have given it the full 5 stars however there were a few negatives to get out the way first. Some of the fittings about the rooms needed maintenance, most of the furniture was worn on edges and the fridge had a big dent in it. There are no duvets, just a blanket wrapped in a sheet, a little weird. The final bad point was having to wait up to 2 weeks (10 working days) to have your bond returned to you. The booking process over the phone was easy and the apartment assigned to us was exactly what I asked for. We got the top floor with city views although the Circular Quay is blocked by Citibank. Only the penthouses were above us but were set back from the building edge. Perfect way to welcome overseas visitors to Sydney. The apartments have everything from washing machine and dryer to dishwasher and toaster. The rooms were also serviced daily even though the blurb said less. The pool section was good with a decent size pool even if a little shallow and a large hot tub. The sauna was broken though. Thoroughly recommend. The price and location is excellent. I cant see how other apartments are worth up to twice the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great option!”
Reviews.Author: Naifa_abril
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a one bedroom apartment, and was perfect. From the begining, the staff was really nice and helpfull. The apartment was very spacious, and the kitchen had everything you could need. It even had its own washing machine and clothes dryer It has a very convenient location, close to the Darling harbour and many restaurants. I will definitively stay in this apartments again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but average 6 day stay”
Reviews.Author: HRHWallis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton for 6 nights at the end of Feb. We had a two bedroom apartment on level 45. The apartment was spacious and quiet. The kitchen had a good range of items. The general maintenance of the apartment was a little lacking - hand towel holders that needed to be tightened, mis-matching glasses and crockery, (some) threadbare towels, stained sofa's, marks on the curtains and walls. Over all it was fine - but if you are expecting lavish luxury then this is not the place for you. The reception staff were friendly and helpful (particularly when our airconditioning broke down). The pool/spa area was clean and tidy, but has only limited minimal seating. The location is fabulous, really easy walking distance to the main shops in Pitt St and the new Westfield mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Service...”
Reviews.Author: Danijel_Melb
Reviews.Content: Party of six stayed in a three bedroom apartment on the 46th floor (4602). Apartment had a great view of the Business district of Sydney and Kings Cross precinct. Considering the number of persons (6), the price per night was far cheaper than a hotel to accommodate the same yet offering a five-star service. The business centre offered basic internet, printing, scanning and faxing facilities which were adequate. The room had great air conditioning. As these are apartments it is important to realise that they are serviced daily. Fresh towels are replaced daily. Beds are made, and rubbish emptied daily. Apartment, like most others offer full kitchen facilities. Internet available for a charge, both wireless and wired. On site parking is available at $35 per day, most will say this is expensive however for a 24 hour period with multiple entry & exit it is actually quite cheap considering it is in PITT Street Sydney. All in all will recommend and if future business is within that district will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LondonAussieGirl
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at Meriton Serviced Apartments on Pitt Street. Great location within the city, always clean and the rooms are modern and comfortable. Coffee shops close by and a nice stroll to the Harbour. The two bedroom suites are great for two couples travelling together and breakfast on the balcony in the sun is a great way to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here a few times in the past few years and both experience were wonderful. We have stayed in both the 1br and 2br suites and cannot say enough about both. The partments were spacious with balconies and very modern. However the 2br was on a higher floor and had amazing views from the rooms and the balcony especially. This place is right in the middle of it all! Close to Italian, Korean, Seafood restaurants and pubs. Darling Harbour and Circular Quay are close walks and so is plenty of shopping.. Great place, definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: mummybear67
Reviews.Content: Meriton on Pitt st saved our Sydney holiday. My children and I were staying elsewhere in Sydney which was a complete dump. So I rang Meriton and booked with them. The service and phone manner of Meriton staff is excellent. The guys on the front desk desk deserve top marks, extremely friendly and polite. The room(we stayed in a 2 bedroom on a high floor) was beautiful, clean and we even had water views. The bed is to die for, so soft and comfy. The only problem we had was that we only had 2 days here!! We will definitely be staying at the Meriton again(and for a longer period of time).

Reviews.Title: “The best Meriton offering in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AussieHolidays
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at all the Meriton Sydney offerings we feel this is the best. We have stayed in a 3 bedroom and 2 bedroom apartments at Pitt Street on different occasions and both are fine for families. Where Pitt Street really wins is location and size. Location - Pitt Street is right in the centre of Sydney. Its location meant we didn't get the car out of the car park once. Shopping, dining, parks and cinemas are all within 200 to 300 metres. Size - Pitt Street is quite small compared to say World Tower. This has benefits in less people at shared facilities like the pool and spa but most importantly less lift wait time. The ability to cook saves real money and with 2 supermarkets within an easy stroll accentuates this benefit. Staff were helpful and cleaning staff obliging. Yes the air conditioning is different with the 4 hour switch off but you get used to it - to be honest if the weather is good you can sleep with the windows open anyway! The only strange thing with the 2 bedroom apartment was the placement the both bathrooms next to each other even though one bedroom was at the other end of the apartment. Pitt Street would benefit from a bit of a paint in the common traffic areas in the apartment but it doesn't detract from the quality of the stay. To be honest a cold beer on the balcony looking towards the Sydney Harbour Bridge as the sun sets is pretty awesome! Cheaper and better than a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: girltalk
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I were travelling with my senior parents so we wanted accommodation that was spacious, close to everything and reasonably priced. My parents can be hard to please when it comes to accommodation and the fact that they were happy speaks volumes! Our apartment was clean, spacious and modern. I highly recommend upgrading to Sky Level. I usually only stay in hotels when travelling but after staying here I've converted to serviced apartment accommodation! Here a the few gripes I have with this place: - bed was a little hard - loud static noise from outside - long wait time for lifts

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Coffs Harbour, New South Wales, Australia
Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, clean, and very spacious”
Reviews.Author: neree85
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, as it was close to all the places we needed - monorail, Myer, Capitol Theatre, Woolworths, even close enough to Darling Harbour and the Power House Museum. Also there is a cupcake store just a few shops away. Even though there are many, many floors the lifts are fast and there is hardly any waiting. Parking is fantastic, and it has an easy entrance/exit, probably not the best if you have a large vehicle. The room we had included 1 king, 2 single beds, 2 bathrooms, dishwasher, air-conditioner, microwave, oven, large fridge not a mini bar fridge, TV, lounge/dinning area, laundry, balcony and our room had a great view of Centre Point & Town Hall. Excellent for just 1 night stay or long term accommodation. Only down side is that you could hear some of the street traffic. Staff are friendly and well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bbbelz
Reviews.Content: Meriton Pitt street is a great choice if you are considering a short or long term stay in the heart of Sydney. First up, the location is perfect for shopping as you are in the heart of the Pitt Street mall area. The bridge and Opera house are about a 15- 20 minute walk too. In regards to options for food and drink- you have plenty to choose from around here! As for the property itself- I stayed for a week on business in a one bedroom appartment. It is very spacious, modern and clean. The kitchen has everything you need, the shower is bigger then the standard and the bed it also a big, king size. The TV is 'old school' but you can make do and they also have a DVD player. They have a swimming pool and a gym too. Fair enough the gym is tiny and they barely have anything for weight training but there are a couple of machines for cardio you can make use of. No issues with service, staff are friendly and helpful and your room gets cleaned on a daily basis. I would definatley stay here again and would recommend for any couples, friends or business trips!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Suetoo62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Meriton for 4 days in January, 2012. We had a one bedroom apartment. It was roomy and well appointed. It had a full kitchen, a nice sized bedroom a comfortable living/dining room and en suite. While we did no real cooking, the kitchen had everything one would need if one was so inclined. The hotel is an easy 15 minute walk to the Circular Quay. It is convenient to public transportation and walking distance to most tourist destinations in Sydney. The hotel is clean and quiet. There is a small gym, a pool and sauna. Parking is available. We did not use it so cannot comment on its cost or availability. The staff is friendly and helpful. This is a wonderful facility for an extended stay in Sydney/

Reviews.Title: “Apartment in the middle of Sydney's shopping Mecca”
Reviews.Author: Kazzapep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with anotherr couple. The hotel was easy to find if you followed your gps and parking directly under the apartment building (which is a real bonus in Sydney). Easy check in and a nice wow factor when we walked in the door of over 100sqm apartment. There were 2 large bedrooms with our own bathroom each. Each room had views over the city. Th views directly in front were blocked by the Citibank building but looking left you looked over glebe and to Birkenhead point and right you could see the harbour by potts point and also the iconic coke sign in kings cross. We also had a Birdseye view of the qvb and the town hall. The apartment was fitted out with all we needed. The sofas were great to lounge on. The balcony was also a big bonus. Pitt street mall was only 2 blockers away. Oxford street walking distance and darling harbour a skip do the road. Only draw back ( which is rather insignificant) is that you do have a constant hum of the air conditioning units from all the surrounding buildings, the traffic and the great sound of laughter outside the bars. But this is inner city. So what do you expect. But keep the doors shut, walk enough through the day and you won't even notice it. Clean, large, well positioned, views,parking. What more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Stunning apartments!”
Reviews.Author: AileenGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 for 4 weeks. Apartments were absolutely stunning 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, one en-suite, large lounge, kitchen, laundry room. Views down Pitt Street towards the Harbour Bridge or out looking over towards Hyde Park. The staff were extremely helpful. Apartments had a small gym and a reasonably sized pool, although cold was really nice after a hard day in Sydney. There was also hot tub, steam room and sauna. Very central for all of Sydney attractions. Across road from Sydney Tower, near Darling Harbour, China Town and the main shopping areas. Close to train links, bus services and monorail. Would recommend these apartments for long or short stay. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect alternative”
Reviews.Author: bmwlepelaar
Reviews.Content: Nice appartments, fully equipment, modern look. Perfect alternative for hotel. Lots of living space.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JACKNFUN
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location. The hotel has easy access to the train systems (just a few steps opposite the Town Hall station), and buses. It is also within reasonable walking distance to all the major departmental store in the CBD area, close proximity to China Town/Haymarket, Darling Harbor, various parks and street eateries. Apartment staffs service was just so-so, superficially polite, then again this might be a bleak point to compare against since the services in Sydney seem to ensure you get what you want and get off their back asap. Everyone seems to rush off work so they can enjoy their own time, who can blame them anyway, this is such a charming place. Apartment is not being cleaned fully everyday, there are full service and light service, when you get the light service some of the amenities are not being topped up, even tea/coffee packs are being missed at times. I am not saying they will not top up for you if you ask, but the point is - why should you ask, it is something that the staffs should do when they clean the room anyway. Good thing are that the apartment comes with washing machine, cooking facilities, and iron/ironing board. This is very helpful if you intend to stay longer than a few days, especially to the families. There is a safe too !! Worth a visit if you prefer location and apartment facilities over luxury. If not, Hilton is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ariane T
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Meriton at 8am after a long flight. Fortunately, the staff were able to check us in early free of charge. The spacious, stylish elevator was my first indicator of the beautiful room that awaited. The one bedroom apartment was decked out with everything we would possibly need during our stay. The living area was large and so was the lcd screen. There was even a decent sized dining table with comfy chairs. The bathroom was more than sufficient with a bath, and a laundry area concealed in a closet. The keys and swipes enable you to take the elevator to your floor and also permit entry to the Meriton after a certain hour; this definitely added an extra sense of security while we were out and about in Sydney. 90% of everything about this hotel was top notch. In my opinion, the only things that were below average was: 1) The reception area/lobby was cramped and rather awkward when a certain number of people were coming and going (which was actually quite often), and 2) Although the staff were helpful, I didn't get the warm, welcoming feeling that they were happy to help me. NOTE: They do take $100 bond/security deposit even if you present a credit card. Please be aware of this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: SusieFromMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton for 5 nights in November and loved it. We found the hotel to be in a great location and loved the quick walks to the Circular Quay, Darling Harbor and to the Town Hall area which was great for the train and the Woolworths. We were able to walk everywhere and only took the train one night as it was raining. The people at the desk were very friendly and we felt quite safe here. We only booked a one bedroom apartment but they gave us an upgrade to a two bedroom (although the second one was locked) which meant we had a huge living room, a nice kitchen with an outdoor balcony and a large bedroom and bathroom. There were windows all around and it was fabulous to wake up in the morning to so much light. The washer and dryer worked perfectly and they supplied detergent. I didn't expect the room to be serviced everyday but it was and always looked great when we came home in the evening. The elevator was not lightning fast but the wait was never more than 2-3 minutes. The wifi was decent in the lobby but we were only allowed limited free access. There is a McDonalds with free wifi just down the street plus an Apple store on the way to either Darling Harbor or Circular Quay that had a great connection so that's where we often stopped to connect. There is fabulous Thai food if you head right once you leave the hotel and walk down just a couple of blocks. I would stay here again in a minute. We took a few tours and told everyone we met about how great our room was and how incredibly well priced it was and people were amazed and a little jealous. Don't hesitate to book here. It's great!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice & location”
Reviews.Author: KazMeath
Reviews.Content: Excellent location half way up Pitt Street (329 Pitt Street). Although Pitt Street does seem to go on forever. I was travelling alone and I felt very safe staying here. The security is excellent. The staff are extremely helpful & friendly. The apt was fabulous, extremely spacious, well equipped, clean & serviced daily. The bed was so big & comfy. Fresh towels and toiletries replaced every day. There is also a washer & drier provided for laundry. I donâ€™t think I could fault the apt one bit. Maybe it was expensive but I feel it was totally worth it. They offer 2 free 30mins wifi sessions to be used it the reception area. Other than that you can get wifi in your room but it is costly. About $20 for 24 hrs. There is also a Gym and swimming pool but I never got the chance to use it. There is a metro stop next door but I never used it. I walked everywhere. It is so accessible. When you come out of the hotel you turn left and follow the street and it brings you directly to Circular Quay, turn right and this will lead you to Darling Harbour. The city is so easy to get around. Circular Quay is a buzz of restaurants and bars and comes alive as the sun sets. It was an amazing feeling to be there and just soak up the atmosphere. Just to sit back have a drink and people watch. I did the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. It was amazing, it is expensive but totally worth it. I had booked it in advance but you can just turn up on the day and book it. I took the ferry to Manly cost about $15 return, there is free wifi available onboard. Another great day out. I went surfing with Manly Surf School. I booked a lesson as I wanted to be within a group. It was $60 and good value. I learnt so much and the instructor was excellent. I took the bus to Bondi. Another great experience. You have to get Fish & a chip in Bondi Surf Seafoodâ€™s, voted the best in Sydney. They also do deep fried Mars Bars although I didnâ€™t get to try one. Due to the weather the beach was fairly quiet and empty but it was still worth visiting. If you are a fan of Bondi Rescue you may catch a glimpse of one of the lifeguards!! Sydney Aquarium is also worth a visit. Admission is $35. You can get some concessions and also there are group tickets you can get for various attractions which will save a few dollars. Paddyâ€™s Market is great as well for a few knick knacks and stuff and the prices are slightly cheaper than some of the souvenir shops outside. Three Wise Monkeys is a nice pub for food and drink, it is quite reasonable too. It is situated at 555 Georges Street. I found Sydney to be cheaper than Melbourne for food & drink. Â The only bad thing I have to say about my trip to Sydney was the weather. It rained the whole time I was there but sure there is nothing you can do about. Also it didnâ€™t stop me from getting out & doing stuff! Wonderful City, I will be back!! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Home comfort with inner city convenience”
Reviews.Author: perthgypsy_10
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully appointed serviced apartment in the centre of Sydney's CBD - only 2km from Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the many attractions which make Sydney a glorious city to visit. The monorail goes past the door, the buses, trains, hop on hop off tourist coaches are all within walking distance. Extensive facilities in the way of shopping, restaurants, tourist attractions and parks are all very close by. The service at the Meriton was superb. The rooms were wonderful, with lounge, dining, kitchen, laundry, bathrooms and bedrooms all tastefully decorated and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for families!”
Reviews.Author: JosephLim
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay somewhere central in downtown Sydney and have kids in tow, there is no better place than Meriton, Pitt Street. Centrally located at the junction of Pitt Street and Bathurst Street, it's 15 minutes on foot to all-time kids' favourites like Sydney Aquarium and Wild Life Sydney at Darling Harbour. To buy groceries, a major Woolworths outlet at George Street is just 5 minutes walk away. Transportation wise, Town Hall train station is less than 3 minutes walk away, which gets you to major attractions like the Rocks, Harbour Bridge and Opera House in just 2 train stops (alight at Circular Quay). Empty taxis whizz pass Meriton every few seconds (maybe that's because taxi is an expensive mode of transportation). For shopping, getting to the factory outlets at Birkenhead Point is a breeze - you can buy a Prepay ticket at the 7-Eleven located just outside Meriton and take Metrobus M50 from Park Street (near the junction with Castlereagh Street). M50 takes you to Bondi Beach as well if you travel in the opposite direction. If you wish to get to the airport, you can pre-book an airport shuttle bus from the reception before your departure date for just AUD$14 per adult. And yes, I forgot to add, the receptionists I encountered were also friendly and most helpful. In terms of accommodation, we took a one-bedroom apartment at Level 18 (note: the ground floor lobby is Level 11). The apartment is well-kept and well-equipped. The kitchenette has all the amenities that allows you to do basic cooking - a stove, sink, oven, microwave, dish washer and all the utensils. Dishwashing liquid is also provided. For laundry, both a spin dryer and washing machine is provided within a small ensuite laundry room (to keep out the noise). Again, laundry detergent is provided. Other than the occassional sirens from the streets we hear at night, the bedroom is quiet and comfortable. This is testified by my one-year old baby who slept through the night, every night, without stirring, for 4 consecutive nights. Attached to the bedroom is a balcony which we did not make use of. Internet service (wired and wireless) is also available within the room at a rate of AUD$18 for 24 hours. The only downside is probably the absence of any view out to the city (despite a large balcony at the bedroom) since we were staying at a low floor and surrounding us were all buildings. But that has an advantage too as it blocks off most of the noise from the busy streets below us. What more can I say, Meriton @ Pitt Street is definitely highly recommended and a convenient accommodation, especially suited for families!

Reviews.Title: “Value in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ilovereggae
Reviews.Content: Bang for your buck in the heart of Sydney. Pay the same price - if not less - as you would for a hotel room, and get the perks of having your own 1 bedroom apartment. Close to everything: trains, trams, monorail, buses, ferries, restaurants, supermarkets, 7eleven, cafes, shopping, malls, chinatown, movies, skytower, parks. Room has washer/dryer, dishwasher, 2x tvs, our room had bath + separate shower, king bed (2 king singles together), dining table, desk, couch. Rooms are serviced daily. Lifts werent a problem for us whatsoever. Note street noise is the norm for Sydney accomodation - the place is buzzing 24/7 so street noise cant be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent facilities, some wear and tear showing”
Reviews.Author: CapitalKiwiGirl
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, 2 mins to monorail station, 2 mins to supermarket, 3-4 mins to David Jones/Myer/Pitt St Mall. Arrived an hour early and helpful check in staff assisted us in storing our baggage. I had requested a high level room with sky views, the room allocated to us "became unserviceable" just as we were about to check in. When we made our way to our 2 bed 2 bath apartment, the 2nd bedroom and bathroom were locked. A quick phone call sorted this out, but the second bathroom was small and and had tiny bits of what my flatmates and I used to call "the dreaded pink mould" around the edges of the shower and floor grouting. My 5 year old daughter just ended up using the spacious and clean ensuite off our bedroom instead. The carpet was a bit worn in traffic areas, but the kitchen was well appointed and spacious, and the view was fabulous. The daily servicing was extremely brief, pretty much clean towels and that was it, but unsolicited, a cleaning manager knocked on our door and asked what we thought of the servicing, and it improved after that. The pool was a hit with the 5 year old and we used it daily, it was lovely with a lap pool and a large spa pool. We had it to ourselves most afternoons. Overall very adequate facilites, fabulous location, some signs of wear and tear. We had no problems with noise/parties/balconies being locked on the weekends as I have read in prior reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and views”
Reviews.Author: lgheartny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton on Pitt for 1 week in November. Overall an excellent stay and the room exceeded expectations. The lobby looks simple and agree with a prior reviewer that the lifts can be quite slow, because there are three for all the 50+ stories and sometimes 1 is used for service (although the lobby level is floor 11 so maybe just 40+ stories). We stayed in a 2 bedroom sky suite and the apt was fantastic. Very clean, good cleaning staff, and the kitchen and all appliances (didn't expect a washer dryer but it was there) were all in good working condition. The kettle was quickly replaced when it died. There was also a terrace so you can eat/have coffee while enjoying the syndey skyline. We were 4 adults travelling with a baby. The baby cot was a bit dated so our baby slept with us instead, big king bed so not a problem. Not sure why a prior reviewer said it was a dodgy part of town - we thought the location was excellent as it was only 25 mins to the harbour, we were surrounded by bank buildings (Citi, HSBC), there were a few malls and small coffee bars and restos all around. There was also a Woolworth's grocery around the corner. You can take advantage and cook in the apartment. Central business districts don't usually build themselves in dodgy areas, and it didn't feel like Wall St where the neighborhood gets a bid different after a few blocks. Good for families. Glad we chose this instead of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ItineraryAus
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were struggling to find accommodation for our annual weekend away and came across the Meriton Serviced Apartments in Pitt Street. What a find. Lives up to all great reviews. Great location with good walking distances from main shopping areas such as David Jones, Myers, Queen Vic Building, Darling Harbour etc and directly opposite the Capitol Theatre where we had tickets to on the Saturday night. Free bus service across the road to take you on the city loop which we utilised to visit the Rocks Markets. Clean, spacious, modern, comfortable, easy to find, friendly and at great prices. Why wouldn't you stay! We will be.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended to stay at”
Reviews.Author: sherylthebarrel
Reviews.Content: The apartments are nice and spacious. Ours was clean and modern. Everything was in working order. We also had a car and parking was no issue. Although it does cost 30.00 AUD a day. Only thing is that the lifts are extremely slow as there are only 3 lifts servicing something like 45-50 floors. Overall an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kojamoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton pitt street over night a week after opening. The rooms are very clean, spacious and I really appreciated having a full size fridge and so much room. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “What a mistake”
Reviews.Author: Cherry3838
Reviews.Content: This serviced residence chain does a good job in its advertising on the net. They appear on most sites. However, location is ina dodgy part of town. Service is apathetic at best except for a young man who helped us with luggage. He told us that there was no luggage service provided. Check in staff was surly. The saving grace was that the apartments were clean and new. I wouldn't ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy15
Reviews.Content: We booked this apartment as a combination of work and study meant that we needed to be in the city. These apartments are a 4 minute walk to both Museum and Town Hall stations and there are lots of cafes and restaurants close by if you don't want to cook. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and we were upgraded as we were staying two nights. The apartment was clean, spacious and well furnished. Our only concern was the balcony door did not shut properly and we had severe storms when we were staying, causing the wind to blow through the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel in the centre of everything”
Reviews.Author: marvs000
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a serviced apartment with a group of friends and quietly converse amongst each other without the fear that youâ€™ll disturb your fellow neighbours in the next room, this place is definitely for you. Meriton Apartments in Pitt Street is an absolute gem in the middle of the city with all the bustling activities within walking distance. The check in procedure was seamless and within minutes of verifying my details, we were in our two-bedroom apartment and for the (sale) price I paid, this was excellent! Usually the pricing of these apartments are $600+ and even I was amazed at the price I got this for. The apartments were clean with the furniture modern and almost brand new; it was the comforts of simple living. We had great views of the city and our Balcony had a great backdrop of the sunset behind the Sydney Tower. We had a great night out with a couple of our friends who had joined us. We were playing music, watching TV and playing board games whilst having a great laugh. It felt as if weâ€™ve lived there as usually the next door neighbours wouldâ€™ve started to complain that we made a lot of noise. This goes to show that this unique establishment had great walls to block out the noise. If the price will drop to the sale that Iâ€™ve received, then I would consider this place again otherwise, I couldnâ€™t afford this on my own. Meriton Apartments is an enjoyable hotelier.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, fantastic location - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Rosalie N
Reviews.Content: Our family of seven stayed at the three-bedroom skyview apartment for four days, and found it to be spacious, modern, clean, comfortable and fantastic value for such a central location. Great views! We had made a few changes to our booking, which is normally disastrous, but the team there were both efficient and really helpful in organising the best and most cost effective deal (Warren, a big thank you!) Everything was organised on arrival, including a complementary wheelchair for my elderly mother. We also appreciated the decent sized indoor swimming pool, spa and sauna. Yes, there was road noise if the doors were open, but this is inevitable for a central city location and not overwhelming. We loved the big windows and natural light for all three bedrooms - even with six adults and a child we didn't feel cramped. The one frustration was the lack of information on controlling the TV - it took us a bit to figure out how to get a DVD to work - and there were a few minor maintenance issues such as a bedlight that didn't work and a loose shower fitting! Otherwise we would highly recommend the apartments - a big thank you to all the staff for making it a really memorable trip for us all.

Reviews.Title: “great location for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: cortez48
Reviews.Content: Nice place to spend a weekend, the conceirge staff are very affable and helpful. The apartments were divine, they were so clean. The views were amazing but the strict policy of the locking of the balcony doors friday & saturday nights is disappointing to say the least. We are all grown ups here and this policy is a bit "over the top".....theres a balcony and we are paying for that privillage, then we should be able to use it! If theres a safelty issue then the Meriton need to address this issue with larger glass screens whatever it takes to allow access to these areas. The balcony is a large part of the ambience of spending time in a hotel with amazing views. The only other issue was the over the top security with everytime we used the lift it took us to the Reception floor......it was bloody annoying. Staying with a party of 22 spread over several floors it would have been nice for all of us to have access everyone elses floors. A lot of time was wasted with keys & taking girls to their levels, come on Meriton sort it out we are paying guests. My only other complaint would be the hairdryer that was provided, we only found 1 per 3 bedroom apartment filled with 6 ladies. Would suggest adding a few more and making sure they have a bit more grunt about them so to speak. I would absolutely stay here again and would recommend it to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartments in a central location”
Reviews.Author: stefarn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. These apartments are very modern and clean, the kitchen had all essential equipment. The rooms were large and very comfortable. It was nice having a balcony, but the balcony would be a bit small if more than 2 people. Though it did have a table and 4 chairs. The location of these apartments are excellent. There is even a large Woolworths just 2 minutes walk away for stocking up on food. Parking was a breeze to access and directly under the apartments accessible by lift. Would certainly reccommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tree1234
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Sydney near Town Hall stations, shops and woolworths supermarket it's the ideal location for a stay in central city Sydney. The staff are very friendly and helpful with an early check in. The room is clean and tidy with all the things you would expected in a serviced appartment.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: crystalblue71
Reviews.Content: I loved the apartment but the only thing was i was staying in the city for special occation and the apartment we had was on the corner facing pitt street which over look a large air condition fan which was very noisey also if you staying on a weekend you are not allowed to open doors onto balconey. Great location close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: tripnotes_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with our teenage children. In our 2 bedroom apartment the teens had their own bedroom and bathroom. There is plenty of room for everyone. The location was fantastic for a quick walk down the street to the Pitt St mall and Westfield centre shops. A supermarket on the same block & a great coffee place rigtht next door were also very handy. We were on the 30th floor and had a good view. With the great kitchen and laundry facilities we hope to go back for a longer stay one day. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location right inthe heart of thinks”
Reviews.Author: keocat
Reviews.Content: We were put up in these apartments by my husbands firm. We found them extremely comfortable with lovely views of the city. Staff were attentive and efficient when needed. The apartments themselves have everything you would need. 5 minutes walk from Darling Harbour and around 15 to Circular Quay. Shopping on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: kiddz
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week in a 3 bedroom room, the rooms have decent size, but the bathroom looks a bit dirty, the edging of the shower door is a bit green. It is a service apartment, yet I don't think they vacuum the room during our stay, not sure if they change the bedsheets during that 5 days. location wise it's great, it the heart of the city, 10 mins walk to darling harbour. If you ask if I would come back and stay here again, I would have to say no, the room rates are quite expensive, for that standard I reckon I should be able to get better ones

Reviews.Title: “location, location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Catherine12333
Reviews.Content: Superb apartment accomodation. The location was perfect, we could walk to any of the attractions within 10mins. Stayed in a one bedroom apt, immaculately clean when we arrived, although housekeeping was'nt great, our bathroom floor was not touched in our 6 night stay. The kitchenette was compact and included a dishwasher. No oven but the microwave was sufficient for cooking needs. The reception area was very small and tight if waiting for lifts or trying to use free WiFi. Internet in room is expensive and should be free nowadays. Reception staff were helpful and pleasant at all times. Booked trip to Blue Mountains for us. Booked directly with Meriton and got a good rate. Do not book a shuttle bus over the internet . You have to ring them when you land and this proved a problem for us because the phone would not connect because did not have proper prefix. There are shuttle buses available there waiting from lots of companies so travelling from the airport is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: xcelr8
Reviews.Content: Room was not ready at 2.30pm - had to hang aroung for nearly 1 1/2 hours before room was ready. Not good follow up from front desk. Rooms clean and had good equipemt in kitchen. Supposed to have a "no party" policy but obviously the guests in the room next to us did know about it.

Reviews.Title: “Out if this world”
Reviews.Author: PaulaGalway
Reviews.Content: My 10 yr old son and I stayed here for 3 nights in July, we rented a one bedroom apartment, it was simply stunning. It out weighed all our expectations, we loved it. It had a large living area with large flat screen t.v,fully equipped kitchen,sitting area and dining area. Large bedroom with another flat screen t.v. Bathroom with separate bath and shower and also a full laundry room, washing machine and a dryer iron and ironing board..... The apartments were so central, we walked everywhere.... My only complaint is that we often waited a while for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, good facilities, more than a weekend required to enjoy all it's facilities.”
Reviews.Author: CandcH
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy service, carparking accessible, very central. Clean and everything you need for a self-sufficient stay in the city. A block from the main shopping precinct. Metres from great restaurants, near the cinemas and the theatre just a skip away. No complaints with this stay. However, the room was not serviced till late in the afternoon so I would recommend when you leave to go out for the day ask at reception if the room can be serviced in your absence. We were floor 19 above street level great being away fromt he noise of the city streets.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent.”
Reviews.Author: Thirstyandhungry
Reviews.Content: Could not fault. Thank you to the wonderful staff. So friendly and helpful. Serviced our room early immediately on request one day when we wanted a mid day rest. Stayed Sunday to Friday and got an absolute bargain. Just be aware that floor numbers start well underground so you are not quite as high up as you might have thought, but this is a minor point.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: AustTrail
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spoil ourselves and went for the Penthouse. We did get a good deal through a coupon offer but otherwise, expect to pay from $680 plus per week-night. (weekends a few hundred more) I wanted to give this place a glowing review because I know they did try hard to make the penthouse an unforgettable place to stay, but it was just lacking that "something" First impressions were not too good. Called up to make a booking and was the staff sounded as though they did not want to work there. Upon arrival however, the girl at the front was friendly. Bear in mind that this is not a hotel, so I did not expect exceptional service. Expect to take all your bags up yourself with the trolleys provided and the lobby is very small so it was hard for me to manoeuvre the damn thing. The staff saw me having trouble but don't expect staff to offer to help! There are only 2 lifts for all the apartments and there is even a sign to tell you that there are usually long delays. So we waited and waited for the lifts to arrive and at last I clumsily dragged our bags up to the penthouse on level 51. The penthouse at Pitt St was extremely large - 3 bedrooms with 3 bathrooms. The living area was very spacious but the bedrooms were surprisingly small. It did however, fit 3 couples well. The kitchen was well equipped and there was also a laundry. The apartment had all the things we needed but it was nothing special as the furnishings were like the other rooms at the Meriton (we've had relatives stay at the 1 bedrooms before) and nothing was overly "luxurious" about the place. 4 stay, maybe but not 5 star. I think I expected too much because it was a penthouse suite. I could not sleep well either because my room was next to the air con exhaust vent. Location was excellent though - Woolworths only 3 minute walk away and most of Sydney's CBD attractions within walking distance. There is no free parking in the complex. It was not a "bad" stay but it was not exceptional either. For the price we paid, it was good but if you pay top dollar for this place, I think most people may be quite disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Studio Appartment”
Reviews.Author: Dennis H
Reviews.Content: This is not our first time to Meriton Pitt Street but it is the first opportunity we have had to review the hotel. The word is impressive because your services and associated staff were just that. It makes all the difference to have such open and helpful professionals in the hospitality industry that care about people especially to those who have booked online and are visiting Australia for the first time. Your website is user friendly with most of the room interiors shown except for interior shots of the studio apartments to which we might add came as a pleasant surprise and worthy of an interior shot to compliment the full range of interiors at the hotel. The room facilities were of a high standard catering for all our needs without exception. The Pitt St location is spot on for walking access to most parts of the cities major attractions its surrounding parklands and public transportation especially the monorail and harbour ferries. What we liked most about the hotel is that itâ€™s in Sydneyâ€™s CBD offering competitively priced excellent accommodation, especially for those booking in advance online. We have already recommended the Meriton to friends here in Australia and Overseas. Thanks for the opportunity to respond to your review

Reviews.Title: “Good Self contained apartment”
Reviews.Author: Rubiru
Reviews.Content: Well equiped apartments, nothing flash but functional. Good location and usually good prices. We have found the weekends are fairly noisy so take some ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot! Great views! Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: chase29
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Meriton. We had a two bedroom apartment which was very spacious and modern with all the amenities we needed. The room was serviced daily which was nice and the staff were friendly at all encounters. We got a good rate for the room at $800 for the 4 nights we were there. The parking was a bit expensive at $35 per day but then that is Sydney for you. My boys had a great time in the pool and spa on the rare occassion that we were not exploring the city. The Meriton was really in a perfect location. It was no longer than 15 minutes to The Rocks, Sydney Harbour, Opera House and even closer to Darling Harbour, Powerhouse Museum, Hyde Park, and the Capital Theatre. I would definitely recommend saying at the Meriton Pitt St.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious central accommodation”
Reviews.Author: hippodreams
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at these apartments for a one night stop over and were extremely comfortable here. The apartments are fitted out to a high standard with quality fittings and furniture, and are extremely spacious. The bathrooms are luxurious and the bedrooms over-sized with the highest quality bedding. Check-in was efficient and the staff were helpful and friendly. There are swimming pool / gym facilities in the building but we did not make use of these. The apartment building is within easy access of Sydney's attractions and there are plenty of eating places nearby for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lindsle1
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about these great apartments. Location was wonderfully close to everything. We were there for Australia Day and the staff helped us find information about all the events, transport to the airport, etc. My husband, brother and I stayed in a two bedroom apartment that was lovely and beautifully maintained. Will stay here on any return trips for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: scorpion212
Reviews.Content: We stayed in luxury. We had a room on the 27th floor I think & the views were stunning. The two bed apartment was spotless & had everything you need for a perfect stay. It even had a washing machine with washing powder & all facilities for cooking. The room was cleaned eveyday. It was great have breakfast in the balcony & take in the beautiful views of Sydney & all its skyscrapers. It was centrally located & within walking distances to all sights & shopping too. Unfortunately it rained quite a bit one of the days. I would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!!! Perfect place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: giacomolasi
Reviews.Content: I stay 3 night in my honeymon the apartement was beautiful. The rooms are very pleasant and comfortable. Very clean , silentious, more than my house ! The kitchens are very well-equipped and include full refrigerator, stove & microwave. Also washing machine and drier in the room!!! The bathroom clean with a magnificent shower!! Also in the building there was a swimming pool and gymn!!!!!! Very close to metro and all the most important attractions also few meter near the lobby a beautiful and delicus cup cake shop! at 100mt supermarket (woolworths)

Reviews.Title: “Most central apartment in the city!”
Reviews.Author: Worldfoodies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Meriton in Pitt st on a short week long visit to Sydney. We got a great rate through Booking.com for a studio apartment. The facilities were very modern and clean and was impressed the studio has a separate bedroom to the living areas. Most studio apartment have all the facilities in one fairly open space. The Meritons' facilities were great; it has a pool, gym & business centre. However the best feature of this hotel is its central location to the CBD of Sydney. you are right in the thick of the shopping,theatre and restaurant district. Town Hall station is minutes away and you are close to all the spoils Sydney has to offer. My only negative criticisms of the hotel is that there are only 3 lifts for 51 floors, so waiting for an elevator in peak times was a slow to say the least. Also the foyer to the building is quite small and there is always people sitting in the corridor to pick up the free hotel internet. At times it looks a bit like a back-packers lobby. However these are reasonably small criticisms for a serviced apartment hotel which has alot to offer. Not to mention the bed were divine to sleep in and for me this is one of the most important feature of any stay. Will definately stay here again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Vacation or experiment!”
Reviews.Author: detoman
Reviews.Content: I've booked the hotel depending on the reviews in tripadvisor but honestly was disapointed. Starting from the arrival from the airport the doors were locked so had to signal a security guy hiding behind a desk he asked me to open it with my keys! After he opened i asked for my luggage to be taken from the taxi so he showed me a trolley and asked to take them my self and to the room! Most tv channels not clear and the only available refreshment was a small bottle of water which costs 3$! Reception is only available on day time highly untrained personel any assistance you'd require they'll try asking you for money in return or pull them selves out some how. I'd call it meriton serve your self appt. Nothing more and been staying at hilton at gc then meriton at sydney was a down grade no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great views and service a surprise”
Reviews.Author: MillyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky and managed to get a great rate of $190 per night for a 2 bedroom Skyview apartment. The website looked great, but for this price surley not! On arrival I was surprised by the small reception area, however, this is not a Hotel, it is serviced apartments. We were given our keys for apartment 4403 on te 44th floor. When I opened the door, it was everything I hoped for. New, clean, modern ,spacious and what a VIEW! The beds were fantastic, and the noise for a city centre site minimal. I did not expect to have the apartment cleaned, fresh towels and beds made for a 3 night stay, but it was all included. The kids loved the pool, spa and gym. Great location for free shuttle bus and monorail station one block away. Will definately be back! No onsite restaurant, but plenty of variety around.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to see the sights !”
Reviews.Author: Filnbarb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend, great little apartment with everything you need, probably one of the best beds we have ever slept in, very comfortable. Clean and tidy all round. Reception very helpful, fast check in having reserved online beforehand. We were perhaps unlucky to overlook another close tall building, but we never paid the extra for a view, so no matter! Would definately stay there again and highly recommend it, excellent value for the money. Also just around the corner from the Town Hall station and 10 mins walk to Darling Harbour. Noticed a couple of times the 3 lifts were very busy feeding all 50+ floors, easy check out system though!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: DianeNSW
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Meriton Serviced Apartment, corner Pitt and Bathurst Street in Sydney CBD. This is a very well located hotel, close to China Town, Centerpoint, Town Hall Station, many restaurants, monorail and Hyde Park. Our stay from the moment we arrived until we checked out two days later was excellent. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was spotlessly clean with everything you could wish for included apart from internet for which a fee is applicable. We were on the 49th floor with a lovely view over the water. The lifts are swift which is important when you are on the 49th floor!! Air conditioning worked very well and there was plenty of hot water. We have stayed with Meriton on several occasions when a good special is on their site. Could not recommend this hotel highly enough especially good value when on a special rate for example 2 bedroom fully self contained apartment $170 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: marlzdaughter
Reviews.Content: I booked a studio apartment on the Meriton website and got a fantastic rate. Asked for a room with a view and we were put on the 24th floor with the explanation that this was the highest floor for the studio apartments and there were other high-rises all around. We were very happy when we saw the apartment and also paid $60 for a relaxed check-out which worked well for us. The room was beautiful - spacious, impeccably clean and lovely to be in. The bed was divine and the kitchen well-equipped. Bathroom is great and privately situated. Location is fantastic - Woolworths around the corner and open til midnight, Gloria Jean's on the corner also open early til midnight, Town Hall station close by and fabulous shopping all around. All staff that we dealt with were courteous, helpful and friendly. We were able to leave our bags when we arrived early, staff phoned us before 2pm to let us know our room was ready and they looked after our bags for an hour and a half when we checked out. They also arranged for a shuttle bus to the airport which picked us up out the front and was only $14 each, so practically the same as the train fare but much more convenient. I highly recommend this property and hope to stay there again. I have no idea what the previous reviewer is talking about and find it hard to believe that any of the Meriton's rooms are run-down. We thought it was beautiful and we were in great need of a decent break due to our current personal circumstances, so we weren't disappointed in any way - quite the opposite. It was so relaxing and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CherieClenick
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Penthouse over queens bday weekend, great location, and great rooms as you would expect for over 1,000k a night. Was very modern. Had to wait awhile for lifts at times throughout the day, but hardly a reason to not come back. Reception quick and friendly. I would 100% stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Tired and run down”
Reviews.Author: zararm
Reviews.Content: These were made on the cheap and haven't aged well. They aren't very clean, they're rather cramped and can hear neighbours. The beds are uncomfortable and the shower wasn't very clean. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment and would rather have spent the money on a 5 star hotel. Next time we will!

Reviews.Title: “mmm...not worth the money and pretty average on all counts”
Reviews.Author: juicyblue
Reviews.Content: I really didn't like this hotel, for a number of reasons. 1) The foyer area is awful.... fluro lighting and the building is shared with some businesses, I think, so it's full of randoms alot of the time 2) The carpark is really confusing and inconvenient, when you first arrive. It's actually on a side street and this isn't clearly shown. Also, you can't really park out the front and drop your bags off (or if someone is dropping you off) 3) Rooms are average at best. The beds are comfortable, but not anything to write home about. They are also all very dark, and look straight into office buildings over the road. I don't THINK that any of them have proper balconies, but I could be wrong on that. 4) No room service to speak of. You can order from some local restaurants (which are very good) but it's pretty limited hours and a couple of the restaurants in the hotel guide no longer service the building. You also can't charge back to your room, so you need to pay each time. The location is very handy (particularly to my office), but there's definitely better apartments and hotels in Sydney. To be honest, I've stayed in the Meriton on Kent Street and I think it is a much much better property than this one. Unless you get a really awesome rate here, I'd suggest looking at the myriad of other serviced apartments in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment”
Reviews.Author: Swissie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2-bedroom skyview apartment. It was a spacious, very clean and had a fabulous location. We booked with Meriton directly which was the cheapest option.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & Plush”
Reviews.Author: Zumba12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Apartments Pitt Street for three nights & were absolutely thrilled with the studio we had booked. We had a very spacious apartment with plush furnishings & fittings. There were sofas to relax in & occasional tables to place our glass of wine!! The kitchenette was well fitted out & had everything we needed to prepare a full meal. There was also a balcony. Best of all these apartments have a 'no party' policy which means that we got a good night's sleep & the room was very peaceful. We couldn't have wished for more in our trip to Sydney & these apartments far surpassed other accommodation we had booked previously. We will definitely book with Meriton apartments again, but wish they had places in all Australian cities!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller53
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 friends stayed in the 3 bedroom apartment at Pitt St Meriton. The reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The apartment was spacious and well appointed. We wished we were staying longer to fully utilize the kitchen facilities. As a separate laundry is also included the apartment would be a great fit for families on extended stays. Cafe and restaurants are numerous if you dont want to self-cater or , like us, only there for the night. Parking is on site for a fee. Would definitely recommend and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Apartment -Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: S00T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March - and really it was very comfortable, quiet and such a handy position - close to transport shops - restaurants - we would definitely stay again - We requested a higher floor - and were not disturbed by any street noise - a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Daren L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meriton Serviced Apartments on Kent Street for 2 nights. I was in a Studio room which was clean, tidy and modern. Good sized room with flat screen TV, Foxtel and small kitchenette. The apartments are located at the Chinatown end of the CBD, close to Darling Harbour and large number of good restaurants. Check-in was a little slow as I arrived at a busy time of the day. The apartments have a nice indoor pool and o.k. gym (I wouldn't call it state of the art though). The only downside is that it was very noisy at night with regular police and ambulance sirens. Given the price and location I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dobo01
Reviews.Content: I had one of the best stays in Sydney thanks to the Meriton Serviced Apartments. The 2 bedroom apartment was perfect. We had a room very high up (as wished for), the views were great, the place was clean and quiet and the team who services the room does a really good job. Keep the good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit from column a....a little bit from column b.”
Reviews.Author: Minxyminou
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 weeks with my partner who was on a business trip. We were in a one bedroom apartment on the 18th floor. The good: *Super convenient central city location. *Kitchenette really well equipped for cooking. *Good appliances. *Large TV. *Enormous TV *Helpful staff. *Quiet well equipped gym area. *Lovely clean indoor pool. The bad: *"King" bed was two single beds pushed together. *Huge balcony was filthy after the first week with cigarette butts and garbage we assume was thrown from other balconies. This was only cleaned once during our stay. *The lifts take a LONG time to come....at any hour of the night or day. *No bath in the bathroom and the grout in the shower needed replacing. *One roll of toilet paper provided by the cleaners during the once weekly room cleaning.. *Small bin and no additional bin bags provided. *Weekends..the apartments are used as a "party base" by many from the outer suburbs on the weekends..sooooo lots of noise and the occasional drama from the drunk and obviously drugged up in the lifts and lobby all weekend. *RIDICULOUSLY expensive internet. Overall it was a pretty good location for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kabby33
Reviews.Content: Excellent apartments. Central to everything ! Helpful staff and great clean rooms. Very spacious and modern. Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wood501
