Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights over New Yearsâ€™ Eve although we were required to pay for three nights because of their NYE minimum booking rule (this appears to be the norm with all accommodation in Sydney over NYE). We rented a two bedroomed apartment; we found that the building was well managed with night security and key swipes to gain access after a certain time, the block was obviously running at 100% occupancy and the wait for the lift was never more than a couple of minutes. The apartment was clean, well furnished, well equipped and thoughtfully laid out. It is in an excellent location; we walked to the Opera House and Darling Harbour with my mother who isnâ€™t as agile as some. The stop for the monorail was just around the corner and the Sydney Sky Tower just a couple of minutes down the road (visit first thing in the morning or you will queue for over an hour later in the day). We didnâ€™t use any of the facilities outside of the apartment itself so cannot comment. We would stay here again if visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Unbelievable service. Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: JJMomRN
Reviews.Content: The Meriton exceeded my expectations in every way. It is centrally located near Chinatown with a lovely 20 minute walk to the Opera House/Harbour area. The views from our 65th floor apartment were unbelievable. The layout was fabulous, three bedrooms, two bathrooms with a wonderful living area and kitchenette that was well equipped. On our second day we found that our refrigerator was not cooling properly and after complaining, the refrigerator was quietly replaced while we were out during the next two hours. We also complained about a water pump alarm outside of our room and each time we complained the alarm was silenced within minutes. The front desk was helpful with everything we asked about, between giving us directions, to allowing us to check in at 10am the day we arrived, dirty and jetlagged to Sydney from the US. They split up our beds to twin beds as we requested quickly. Really, overall a good value when you consider the amenities and how many people could stay in one apartment. The beds were incredibly comfortable (in fact, probably some of the best night's sleep I've ever had in a hotel). This is in contrast to many people claiming the beds are horribly uncomfortable. All 6 of us slept great. I really have nothing but good things to say - a real find in beautiful Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: NelsonUKSouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at these apartments on arrival to Aus from the UK. They are very central , secure , and very handy for all forms of public transport. The facilities provided are exceptionally good with a well sorted kitchen, full washing and drying facilities in the apartment. There are several 7 Eleven type shops and Bottle shops close by. The quality of the furniture and appliances was very good and , despite the rent being on the high side , I would strongly recommend this facility. Nelson

Reviews.Title: “Most suitable for families!”
Reviews.Author: wct38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pitt Street Meriton for a week. Rather than staying in two separate hotel rooms, the family enjoyed spending time together in the living room. the apartment was spacious and the kitchen was really useful when we got sick of eating out. Though they said the room would be serviced fortnightly, they do change towels whenever we want and most importantly, clear the dustbin daily. A note for the management though, I stayed at 2 different apartments at Pitt Street and at a third apartment at Bondi Junction, all the TV channels were not properly set! I also found the dish washer to be not working properly. Other than that all else was great with my stay at Meriton. No problem with the lift; and the staff, from those at the reception to those who changed our towels, very helpful and always cheerful. I would stay there again and recommend it although the price ($750 for a 2 room apartment) can be a big deterrent.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as usual”
Reviews.Author: OffWeGoOnATripAgain
Reviews.Content: We regularly stay at this hotel when on business in Sydney, in a 2BR apartment. Usually the apartments are spacious and comfortable, but this time we were given a room on level 21 that was very small and the only view from the living area was of a brick wall! Very disappointing. The other issue is that there was basically no water pressure at all in the showers, basins or kitchen sinks of a morning or evening, so it was pretty much impossible to have a shower before work - not good enough when it cost us $625 for a Saturday night stay!!! Without reassurance that the water pressure is resolved and that we are being given one of the better rooms I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: scarz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a three bedroom apartment for a week at the Pitt Street complex. The apartment was great. We chose a 'Sky View' apartment and so were on the 42nd floor with fantastic views over the City including Kings Cross, Sydney Harbour and over to Darling Harbour. The location was also great, being right in the centre of the City and with the monorail going right past us (the monorail station was a 2-3 minute walk away). The Town Hall or St James train stations are only a short walk away and there is also a Woolworths Supermarket in the same block as these apartments. The price for the accommodation wasn't cheap and it increases over the weekend nights, but it suited what we wanted on many counts. The apartment was fully equipped with kitchen and laundry, although the dishwasher wasn't working properly. I had read reviews where people advised that the lifts were slow, however, I didn't think this was the case at all, given that there are so many floors for them to travel to. There is no restaurant as part of the complex, however there are menus from surrounding eateries who will deliver and 'charge back'. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View from 34th floor”
Reviews.Author: bwb512
Reviews.Content: Booked on lastminute.com.au with a great rate for a studio apt for 5 nights. Upgraded upon check in to a BEAUTIFUL two bed two bath with views across Sydney from the balcony. While it was nice to have the extra space of a larger apartment, the furnishings and facilities of this property were exceptional. We were within walking distane of everything and had an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: SamiSeppala
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the best i have ever been. Big apartments with great italian kitchenware, 2 television sets with cable, stereo systems and GREAT views over the city. It is clean and modern place to stay in Sydney. Close to chinatown so you can easily walk anywhere, or take monorail to Darling Harbour for a drink or meal. Woolworth is just couple blocks walk, bottle store close to that. I liked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities - but pricey”
Reviews.Author: MrsA2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street for 8 nights in a one bedroom apartment. Great location as most of the main tourist attractions are within a 20 minute walk.. Apartments are well equipped and serviced daily. We found it quite expensive, and they take a $100 AUD bond when you check in which is refunded after you leave, but that said, it was much more comfortable and homely than staying in a hotel. We would stay there again if we return to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Lifeless and cold these places now also take a bond from you.”
Reviews.Author: WestAusTraveller
Reviews.Content: Be aware a lot of places are now also demanding to take a bond from you. Not only do they swipe your credit card for things that you may take out of a mini bar, they also now take a bond of $50 or $100, on top of the rate, which they say they will refund within a few days of you leaving just in case you take anything. My god that is so insulting. The staff were unfriendly and cold just like the place itself. The room that we booked was a one bedroom apartment but it was very small dark and rather cold and not comforting and friendly. The beds weren't comfortable and the layout of the room wasn't well thought out. It is not a place I would every go back to. If you got a family and want to stay for a long period it wouldn't be bad because the rate is very reasonable for sydney but it is not the type of place I would every choose to go for comfort and good service because they need to do a lot of work in that area.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: hay_renay
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, it's so clean and the rooms are very spacious! It's in a great location also!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment!!”
Reviews.Author: Kylee_182
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for new years and the apartment was fantastic. The room was large, clean bathroom and a good sized balcony. There is a pool and gym on site and a bbq to use. Great facilities. Would stay here again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Meriton Service Apts, great view, great location”
Reviews.Author: jeanandfamilykauai
Reviews.Content: Ten minutes walk to Darling Harbour, 20 min walk to the Opera House. Good area of downtown. Fantastic view from 71st floor! Recommend it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Smart tidy apartment in a great location”
Reviews.Author: annieandnick
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights over NYE. It was a great spot and the apartment was modern, well equipped and well set out. So much better than a pokey hotel room. They make it clear the apartment is not fully serviced every day and thats fine... what they did do was sufficient. We expected some wait for lifts, it wasn't an issue. The staff were fine... not as professional as may be found in a good hotel but friendly and professional enough. The walk to Darling Harbour was about 10 minutes, to Circular Quay about 20 minutes. the monorail & Town Hall stations are not far. Its a great location and good value. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: adventuresabroad
Reviews.Content: This was our last place to stay while visiting Australia and it was the best. We stayed at the "World Towers" apartments and were on the 74 floor with a great view. The rooms were very spacious as were the bathrooms. Our living room was comfortable and inviting. It is also in a great location in Sydney and easy to get to trains.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: mcusmc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with another couple, stayed at MSA Pitt Street in a skyview 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit on the 35th floor while in Sydney. Location was close to Sydney harbor, Darling harbor, the monorail and one block from train station. Apartment was well furnished including kitchen, dining area, living room, balcony overlooking harbors, in unit washer/dryer, etc. Staff was very helpful and, despite other reviews, we found the elevators (lifts) as efficient as those we have in the US. All in all, we'd recommend this facility as a less expensive alternative to hotels close by with substantially more room and a more relaxing environment in which to spend in-room time.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality apartments in an ideal part of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AndyB1250
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only stayed one night before we caught the train to the Blue Mountains. We had hoped to book another night but the hotel was fully booked. You definitely get a better rate booking on the internet as far in advance as possible. Only a short walk from "town hall' station and a short walk to Darling harbour and main shopping streets. Apartment fully equipped with washing machine (that we used as it was an ideal point in our holiday to refresh our clothes). Great shower, flat screen TV, great bed etc Staff were not too helpful when we said we wanted to extend our stay but quality of apartment was great. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large apartment with excellent view”
Reviews.Author: LucyLu007
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom sky view apartment (me & my husband, sharing with my parents) and must say was one of the best places we stayed during our trip. The apartment was very large and comfortable, nicely furnished, with kitchen, living room area, a dining area, nice balcony with great views, washing/drying machine (and washing powder) and what is in my opinion very important when travelling with more people, two bathrooms. Enough towels (changed daily) and bathroom amenities. Very large indoor pool, and good gym facilities. The only slight negative could be the noise from the ventilators of the nerby building (nearly not hearable if windows closed though). I would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: This was a GREAT surprise. Meriton Serviced Apartments was a business traveler's dream!! Unassuming lobby looks like it was an afterthought, but it does not match the beauty of the apartments upstairs. The apartments can be different from each other. Mine was really, really large. Full kitchen, washer/dryer, large living room with comfy furniture, dining table and desk, good size bedroom and huge bathroom, and a large balcony. Great views (although a bit noisy with the sliding doors open). The pool/hot tub/exercise room was great. Amazing location allows you to walk all over - and I did! 5-10 minutes to Darling Harbour. I actually walked all over the city and returned to this lovely spot. I only have one suggestion: wish there was a television set in the bedroom. I only have one regret: not staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “You could not ask for a nicer place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: paigeeickelberg
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at the Meriton on Pitt St in the fall of 2009. We returned for a short stay again recently. We thought we had reserved a studio apartment but apparently we made a mistake in our reservation. They upgraded us to a 2 bedroom for no extra cost. The apartment is lovely and felt like we were coming home. We did not care about having a view, but if you do care, you best specify that. The apartment was very clean, the staff friendly and the bed was wonderful. The train station, grocery store and beautiful shopping mall are all within walking distance. I would highly recommend the Meriton at Pitt and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and affordable rate makes it a gem in sydney cbd”
Reviews.Author: ShhConnie
Reviews.Content: stayed at the one on kent st for 5 nites in oct. the studio sized room is very affordable at aud155 per nite booked via the official hotel website. great sized room with kitchenette and a two persons dining table. daily housekeeping plus in room washing machine. altho the drying function doesn't work very well. well maintained and clean room. location very convenient walking distance to darling harbour, chinatown, cockle bay, townhall train staion, world square monorail. a lot of nice dining places along darling harbour for steaks and seafood even found a nice korean restaurant just around the corner. would def stay here again and recommond to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK”
Reviews.Author: Kristie617
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Meriton Pitt Street location for 5 weeks in late August/early September on business. The location was fairly central in the city and made getting around quite easy. The only downside to the location is that it's in what could be considered to be quite a party location. Tons of bars and late-night places open which might be great if you're younger and looking for that sort of thing, but which wasn't really a comfortable fit for a business traveler. The elevators as others have mentioned, were a horror show. I think I waited 20 minutes or so at some points for a lift. Checking in was also pretty annoying. I had just flown in on a 9 hour flight and was absolutely exhausted on check-in. I received no help with my baggage and was pointed to a trolley I could use myself if I wanted to haul my luggage to my room. How helpful. I had to wrestle the trolley with my bags through all of the young party-goers hogging the lift to go out at night. All in all, it took me probably 45 minutes to just get into the room. On my own. In the middle of the stay, the dishwasher broke down and spewed water all over the carpets which was disgusting. The housekeeping was a bit hit or miss. At first they were coming daily. Later it seemed they just came once a week. I called to check on it and they said it was supposed to have been 2x a week. Also? The oven in the apartment was INCREDIBLY confusing to use and there were no instructions on it in the apartment manual. And, the rates for using the wifi were outrageous. That all said, it was a perfectly ok apartment. It was quite comfortable and centrally-located.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey however great location and beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: mags2198
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2BR apartment for 3 nights. Each bedroom was spacious and had its own modern and clean bathroom. The living room was small but cozy, as well as the dining room. The kitchen had a stove, dishwasher, fridge as well as cutlery, dishes, pots, pans and toaster. The apartment was very clean and had floor to ceiling windows which provided a very nice view of Sydney. The building had a well equipped gym which I used every day consisting of two treadmills, two stationary bikes, an elliptical machine and a weight machine. There was also a good sized pool and a hot tub for guests. The room was expensive but the location was great. We were smack in the middle of the city, walking distance to everything. We walked to the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and were one block from Hyde Park and right by Chinatown. The only downside was that despite the price of the apartment wifi was not free and in fact was $5/hour. I would recommend this hotel if you want a nice clean apartment in the center of it all with nice views.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful apartment with an amazing balcony view sheer heaven”
Reviews.Author: Dido052
Reviews.Content: The Meriton Serviced Apartments where I stayed for 3 nights in Sydney was a really luxurious clean apartment with a fantastic serene view off the large safe balcony where I had my breakfast every morning looking down on the traffic going by and admiring the serene view opposite of beautiful greenery. I would have stayed on more nights if there had been availability but wasnt to be. I am definitely going back there, ideal location to supermarket and eateries and in service food delivery menus. Thanks you Meriton for my memorable last 3 days in Sydney, and for your help with getting my luggage out on departure, as I needed assistance, thanks to the friendly male staff member for being so courteous to me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: stewir
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Meriton Pitt Street was wonderful. The apartment is roomy, clean and well appointed. It's nicely located near Queen Victoria Building and Hyde Park with plenty of shops, grocery store and cafes nearby. Kitchen and bathrooms were updated and modern. We splurged for the "sky view" (I think that is what they call it) which guarantees a high level floor with a view and balcony. The major downside of staying here is their policy of locking the doors to the balcony on Friday and Saturday nights. This was a big disappointment for us since our 4 nights stay included both Friday and Saturday. Apparently they have had problems with "partiers" throwing objects off the balcony. Which I can understand being a problem but not sure why everyone needs to be punished for the behavior of others. There has got to be another way to handle, especially when renting to a bunch of calm 45 + year olds from the states that are in bed by 11 ;-) The only other slight negative is that we found ourselves always heading up to the rocks/opera house area of Sydney which was quite a hike especially after a long day. The free #555 bus that runs up and down Elizabeth Street from circular quay was helpful but it didn't run past 5ish. Finding decent accommodations similar to the Meriton in that location was not easy for the price point we wanted to pay. Another tip for travelers with luggage, don't take the air train, although it's fast and convenient there are no lifts and LOTS of stairs to get up to the ground level from the train stop. If you have more than 1 person with luggage spring for a taxi. All in all the apartment was great. Probably the nicest place we stayed at while in Oz.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: kevincognito
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sydney for 6 nights during a 3 week australia vacation and we couldn't have found a better place based on location and price. We were 2 couples which rented a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom sky suite on the 46th floor. The views of Darling Harbor & the rest of the city from the huge balcony were breathtaking. The suite was spacious, very clean, had a full kitchen, washer & dryer and was cleaned daily. It was definately one of the cleaner rooms we have ever stayed in. We did not use any other of the facilities in the hotel so I can't comment on the pool or business centre. What I can say is that the front desk staff was very helpful with advice on restaurants and tourist type ideas. When we had first arrived it was early in the morning so they allowed us to check our luggage into a secure room and let us go up to the pool to use the change rooms to clean up get ready for our first day in the city. The location could not have been better. So for $250/night we were about 4 blocks from Darlling Harbor, 4 blocks from Chinatown, 2 blocks from the Pitt Street Mall, and 1 block from the subway which will take you to Sydney Harbor and the ferry terminals in 2 stops. No need for a car when you stay in the city however we rented a car on 2 occasions from Avis 2 blocks away in order to travel to the Hunter Valley and the Blue Mountains. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Sydney who wants to be in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MSambidge
Reviews.Content: I had requested a quiet room to recover from jet lag and that's exactly what we got, in fact, much quieter than I'd have thought for central Sydney. Perfect! Spotlessly clean apartment, all mod cons, friendly and helpful reception staff, very spacious living area. Would DEFINITELY stay there again and have recommended to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been good except the room was cold”
Reviews.Author: TitchfieldAmber
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 bedroom apartment on the 45 floor. A good location in the centre of the City. Rooms were very clean and generously furnished. There was an obvious problem after the 1st nights sleep with every one experiencing an uncomfortable cold at night. The air conditioner was faulty, even though it appeared to work when resetting. Also the hotel policy of the Air conditioner switching off after 4 hours was in operation. Sydney was cold on the nights we were there. Only thin duvets were on the bed, and no extra bedding was in the apartment. We in fact put on clothes to keep warm. Before the 2nd night, we requested that the blankets and extra bedding provided. These were duly delivered and the room service attempted to reset the control for the air conditioner. The extra blankets and duvet were appreciated on the 2nd night. The maintenance personal checked out the air conditioner of the 3rd day, but on returning at 8pm, found that he had left a note to say it was faulty and needed a new part. On phoning reception to ask what it meant, their initial reply was the room was warm when he had gone up there. We requested a further blanket and explained that this was not a cheap backpackers place to stay. After an hour, he phoned back and said he would refund approximately a third of the cost. Have yet to see this credit, but it was a form of recompense that was not asked for. The 3rd and last night was just as cold--thank goodness for the extra blankets. The central heating system is switched off after 4 hours to "save the environment' Obviously if the system had worked in the first place it may have. The policy is to save the hotel money I believe, as it takes more power to keep heating a place from cold to hot than keeping a constant temperature. Having stayed here before, something is seriously wrong with policy and also the time it took to look into the situation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: IGA
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights in these serviced appartments in Sydney - family of 6 in the 3-bed version. Couldn't fault value for money. Location pretty good (south of CBD - close to monorail, on edge of Chinatown), good views. Appartment very functional, but looking a little tired. Lifts can take a few minutes to arrive. Otherwise though a pretty good option and certianly very competitive vs hotel for a family group, plus of course you can self-cater as much (or as little) as you want. A Woolworths supermarket just round the corner so easy to shop 7 days a week for provisions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in centre of city”
Reviews.Author: awful_in_aqua86
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio apartment in the Meriton on Pitt St last week while in Sydney for a job interview. I got the apartment for $100 on wotif, and was amazed at how nice the room was for so little money. It was only a few blocks from my interview, the staff were friendly and the bed was comfy. The room was large and had a small table, couch and armchair. The bathroom was fine, with a big shower. The only problem was that the neighbours were having a party literally ALL NIGHT, and the room wasn't soundproofed well enough, so I could hear them yelling goodbye outside my door and laughing from inside their apartment. They were still loud when I eventually gave up and got up around 6:30 in the morning. I could have complained to the front desk, but couldn't be bothered because I just wanted to get to sleep. The accomodations were great, but noise not so much.

Reviews.Title: “apts with style in sydney”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: if you want a studio apt style stay in Sydney...this hotel group is great. I was really surprised. The check in was slower than a hotel, and the keys are like library passes...but, once you swoosh up to the upper floors, the suites are really good. Well appointed, small kitchenettes, wifi worked, great shower (no bathtubs)...and decent toiletries. Rooms were quiet and well air conditioned/heated. There was a pool/gym...very good space and clean. But, be warned - the changing room/locker room is disappointing...obviously, this place is for short term workers who are in Australia to work...daytime the place is empty and quiet...but from 5:30 - 7pm it is busy (gym, lobby, lifts) and in the morning...there is a rush out the door to get coffee and get to work. If you want to feel like you are 'living' in Sydney...this place gives you that vibe. Was really surprised, and pleased. The hotel lost my dry cleaning one day and it took another 24 hours to be returned..however, they picked up the charge for the inconvenience which made up for the frustration..though, I went shopping in Sydney and found some great shops! Overall, a great place to stay for business. Not a hotel, but convenient for work and value for money at a corporate rate.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location and Very Clean/Neat”
Reviews.Author: rjmacf
Reviews.Content: Great location on Pitt Street although you will think you have landed in Hong Kong by mistake! This place is ideal for those with more than three kids who need three bedrooms at a reasonable price. This is keenly priced but is not low rent in its upkeep. It has everything a family trip would need. The washer and dryer are great so yu can leave with no huge bag of dirty laundry. The beds a little hard but not the end of the world. The view from the 44th floor is great but even up there Sydney has one noisy group of cops who seem intent on playing with their sirens all though the night which is strange as Sydney is not a problem place for crime on anyones map. The locals when you find them away from the Chinatown area and tourists are very typical capital city types (yes we all know the capital is technically canberra but who goes there!). Mostly young, high disposable income want to show off in restaurants etc. Lots of those at the beaches even in the dead of winter. There is a serious issue with drink driving in Australia so if you hire a car and drive outside the city take care. The police can and do stop anyone for no reason to breathalyze them with good cause. Australians are also very aggressive when in a car. They will drive you off the road if they think you are too slow yet their road manners with respect to speed limits couldn't be better. Again the police and due to the low crime rate they are retentive about traffic offences and totally stupid about parking. Don't try talking to rangers. Firstly they will likely be immigrants and speak fractured English, second they don't ask for nor respect apologies so don't waste your breath, save it for the breathalyzer, you will get one of those too. The hotel has good underground parking but it is very expensive at 35 AUD day. On balance its worth it of you need to travel out of Sydney. Be very careful with the TAG system for the freeways. They levy HUGE fines if you don't phone in to pay within 48 hours. Again no flexibility and stupidly no way to pay by cash. Totally stupid system and very typucaly Australian like the cross city tunnel that cost a fortune and no one needed It's a North South city dummy!! Places to go well you ca walk to most from Pitt Street. It is a gorgeous city if a little over the top with its own wonderfullness. Don't bother looking for news as you won't find any. If you like a laugh look a the TV ... it's hilarious for five minutes. No wonder everyone lives outside and pays a fortune to see the harbour. Central Sydney can be seen on foot in a day and you can finish it off by taking a ferry to Manley for dinner and back. Avoidthe observation tower, a total waste of cash as is the comedy monorail but strolling around you can see darllng harbour bridge; wildlife sanctuary and opera houes; botanical gardens in one walk. Do NOT use the city convenience stores which appear to be a huge rip off but this block is right next to Woolworths (not the UK/US place but a simple supermarket shop with food etc). Its a great city and this is a great place to stay. One caveat, he gym is atrocious (no air con and I can't imagine what it smells like in summer) and the pool is tiny. Both strangely on a floor let out to English language schools and places for migrants to prepare for their naturalisation interviews. Very odd!

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations”
Reviews.Author: fiona1102
Reviews.Content: A week in Sydney with an 16 year old girl doing work experience and an 11 year old daughter just hanging out with Mum....... I booked in April for a July visit and got great rates for a two bedroom serviced self contained apartment. Wasn't intending to cook but breakfast is not something I want to pay to eat out for so that toaster and kettle came in handy for the light breakfast. Two minutes from a 4 level supermarket means that if you do want to cook there is nothing you can't eat. It is such a busy city however, there is a million eating out choices - you can even see McDonalds from the street (unfortunately!) I paid a little extra and got a sky view (49th floor) an amazing view for those who like heights. With a washer and dryer I didn't come home with any dirty clothes - love that. We swam in the pool and played billiards nearly every day. I didn't get to the gym - oh well. The lifts seem slow but there are 51 floors so it takes a while. The staff were so friendly and very helpful with transport information; internet at $5.00 an hour seemed fair to me as I was just checking emails. The rooms made up daily when it suited us, which was great when we slept in. I don't get out much but I was really impressed. Well done

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Bowza1000
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation based on a few criteria. 1) We could have a view of something 2) We could have a balcony 3) We could have a REAL king bed and not two singles pushed together Obviously, they can not guarantee the first two, but I was told the beds are REAL kings. SO - We check in. We are on the 22nd floor (which is actually the 11th because there are 11 floors of parking below ground level) and the only view we have is of a grey office block. Street noise is a bother at that height. Then I am told that balconies are locked on Fri and Sat night for safety reasons. Then I realise our bed is in fact two singles pushed together. Then we ask for a late check out, only to be told that it's $50 per hour after 10am for a late checkout. The heater/air con is too loud to sleep with it on and because of the way the studio rooms are set up you can hear everyone's doors opening and closing (hard) all morning and night. Apart from all that the rooms etc were actually quite nice (although carpet would have been nicer than tiles). What a bummer. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Sensational!”
Reviews.Author: neb24
Reviews.Content: I have made MANY trips to Sydney with young children over the last few years and stayed in lots of apartments but none have been better than the Meriton Serviced Apartments Pitt Street. My husband and our 3 young children stayed in a two bedroom, two bathroom apartment. Here's what we thought; Pros * Spacious * Spotlessly clean * Well appointed (even washing powder and dishwasing liquid was replaced daily) * Fantastic indoor pool and separate spa * Convenient to ALL Sydney has to offer eg. literally around the corner from Monorail station, train station, restaurants, cafes, Woolworths Supermarket. or an easy walk to attractions like Darling Harbour. * Windows are all double glazed so street noise is minimal (note that we were on the 34th floor). * New building (2004) * Fast elevators * Friendly and helpful staff * Absolute VALUE at only $190 a night - couldn't believe we got a near-new, spacious, spotless, 2 bedroom apartment in the middle of Sydney for this price! (We booked direct after looking up quikbeds, wotif, etc. and the hotel bettered their price). Cons * No blankets on beds (only sheets and a VERY paper-thin doona) this was inadequate at night time in winter in Sydney. Also seeing as the Air Conditioner (on the 'heat' setting turned off automatically after 4 hours - we woke up cold at night and someone always had to get up to turn the heat on again). * Although we didn't use it as we flew to Sydney, I think the only other negative would be that they charge $35 for car parking but if you can secure a great rate like we did, it's still cheap. Other than this it was PERFECT and we will definitely be staying there again when we return to Sydney in the future.

Reviews.Title: “"As good as it gets" for the price”
Reviews.Author: wabbit10
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 48th, great views, great two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment, apartment well serviced, stayed Mon-Fri. Check-in effiicient. Have stayed there previously and will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: CanberraSully
Reviews.Content: Very happy with these apartments. Beautifully furnished and clean++. Not the greatest view but otherwise perfect with young kids. Well stocked kitchenette for those who want to cook on site, and lots of places to eat within a block if you want to eat out. We had no car, and found it very easy to get to the apartments via train from the airport (even with a busy 3 year old and 8 month old) We found the cheapest deal was through the meriton website itself. Highly recommeded and would def. stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mehdi-A-R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meriton during Easter, I had my in laws with me from overseas and that was their first visit to Australia, they were really pleased with everything. the location is absolutely fantastic and close to everything, the staff are friendly and the point is the breathtaking views this hotel has to offer. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanna experience luxury in line with great deal. actually you'll get the most for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: willtravel67
Reviews.Content: As is our custom, we booked a top rated trip advisor for our latest overseas trip and, as usual, we were well rewarded. These apartments offer outstanding value for money; kitted out like a 5 star suite, for 3 star money. We arrived at 08:30, but were offered a room immediately, which was simply brilliant. It had everything you could possibly want to self-cater should you want to eat in, not that we did beyond breakfast; especially as there are good and inexpensive cafes either side of the apartments. The apartment was extremely comfortable indeed and the Meriton is within easy reach of all the major attractions, either on foot or by using public transport (if you're staying a few days or more, it's worth getting a MyTravel Weekly pass that covers trains, buses and ferries). If you rent a car, be aware that the Meriton charges $35 a day, although they waived it for us because we only used it overnight on out last day. We wouldn't consider going anywhere else next time we go to Sydney and suggest you don't either!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Sorj101
Reviews.Content: This is like a home away from home. Great location, great rooms, great swimming pool. Perfect position! Not as fancy as a hotel - but much more comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “roomy apartment great location”
Reviews.Author: miffycat15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend before flying out to Hong Kong and found the apartment to be much more convenient for us than a couple of hotel rooms. We could easily walk to the Harbour Bridge/Opera House/Ferry Terminals too-and caught MTR/buses to Bondi beach and Paddington Market-Manly Beach a bit disappointing-all a bit scruffy but it was late on a Saturday evening.... Very busy in central Sydney at night but a Woolworths on Pitt Street stocked everything so we grabbed some food there. The pool a decent size but really cold-went in the jacuzzi and sauna instead!

Reviews.Title: “Balconies are locked on the weekends.”
Reviews.Author: brown_betty45
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom apartment with another couple on a Saturday night. Check in was at 2pm and we got there at 2:30 and had to wait 15 minutes before our room was ready. The receptionist was rude when we were checking in and tried to charge my credit card twice for their $200 holding deposit. We were staying on the 41st floor as we had paid extra for a sky view room and when we got up there the balcony doors were locked. Apparently the terms and conditions state that you cannot have access to the balconies on Friday or Saturday nights. 5 minutes after we got to our room the phone rang and they told us they were sending up a maintenance person to fix a light, and the woman that called hung up on me when I asked her about the locked balcony. Then the maintenance guy arrived with a ladder and told us he also had to fix the shower door and started hammering away in the bathroom. The location is great, but I would not stay here again and would not recommend it to anyone because of the terrible service and the fact that the balconies are locked. Also, the fine print on page 19 of the hotel guide states that there is a $100 fee if you don't wash up all of your own plates and cutlery. Perhaps they could put that somewhere promient in the kitchen so that people are aware of the fees.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: steveparky
Reviews.Content: Ecellent base to stay, most attractions and pubs within walking distance, 6 of stayed on the 44th floor with glass everywhere it took a few hours to get used to the hight but the views over the city where excellent. Staff could not do enough for you (well except give extra keys) but the night staff wher ejust as helpful and did not mind ensure I got to my room when wosrt for wear :-)

Reviews.Title: “Practical”
Reviews.Author: brownie06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton on Pitt Street for a week. The hotel worked for us for the following reasons: The rates were reasonable, the room we got was clean and had great a great veiw and it was walking distance to all the tourist attractions. What dissapointed us was the lukewarm service from the staff, the fact that it was always crowded (especially the lobby) and a poorly equipped kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bigtwinky
Reviews.Content: Great apartment. It is located perfectly on Pitt street, a block away from a train station (allowing for trips to Bondi and such) and about 20 minute walk to Circular Quay. Near shopping on Pitt Street Mall and near Chinatown for some good eats. The rooms were modern, clean and had lots of space for 2 couples. Very highly recommended, loved my stay here and will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location and apartment”
Reviews.Author: GCAfricaAddict
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days in late March 2010 in a skyview 2 bed apartment and was impressed with the efficient friendly staff, clean spacious room and amazing view. It was very convenient to restaurants bars and the major sights. Will definitely stay here again on my return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: PCTKL
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom apartment for 8 nights after reading the good reviews. Upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised. The apartment was everything what the reviews said, it was spacious enough for a family of 4, clean and modern. Its location was fantastic, with Woolworths just around the corner and Coles just a few minutes' walk away. Chinatown and Darling Harbour were also within walking distance. A minor complain was our washing machine broke down 2 days before our departure, and the staff said it was beyond repair. Other than that, the rest of the appliances were in good condition. Overall, we are very satisfied with our choice of hotel and will definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “The way to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Durham_explorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my adult daughter for 3 days. The apartment was on the 65th floor and had amazing views across Sydney. It was incredibly spacious and well equipped with a superb main bathroom. The kitchen had everything you could wish for from dishwasher to washing machine and tumble drier. The staff on reception were helpful. It has to be said that it is pricey, but as in all things, you get what you pay for and for a once in a lifetime trip to Sydney it fitted the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Biggles023
Reviews.Content: Being 2 couples we wanted a serviced apartment with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms - picked the Meriton based on past reviews. We were on 44th floor overlooking Darling Harbour, but also the air conditioning unit on the neighbouring bulding so asked for a change - given choice of 2 but both on lower floors and considerable darker than ours,. Stayed where we were - apartment well- equipped and comfortable. Location excellent for getting round Sydney. Only downside was cleaning - we realise this was a serviced apartment and not subject to the full cleaning expected in a hotel but after 4 days we had to ask for the floor to be vacuumed. We also needed the iron to be changed. Every time we asked for anything at reception it was delivered or sorted at once - staff always very helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjc08
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment at the Meriton on Pitt St. with 5 girlfriends, and we all loved the apartment. It worked out to be very reasonably priced considering the apartment. It is in the perfect location. It's walking distance to everything we wanted- sights, restaraunts, shops, clubs, supermarket close by, 7/11 very close, etc. The room was amazing. Great views, very spacious, good furniture, well set out with the main bedroom being close to the kitchen, lounge and dining area with the other 2 bedrooms down the other end of the apartment. The only negative feedback I have is that the staff on reception were very rude. But we had everything we needed in our rooms and only minimal contact with staff so it was a small price to pay for such a lovely room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Excellent Location, Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: CCK01
Reviews.Content: We stayed on level 34 for four nights. The rooms are very clean and huge - excellent for a family of five!!! The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms large. The views are great and the walk on the balcony an adventure for me - vertigo! The kids loved the place and they had room to run around. The kitchen was great with everything one needs. We permanently parked under the building which costs $30 p/day however when you factor this into the room price it is still fantastic value. The location is outstanding. Everything is within walking distace. We caught the ferry to Taronga Zoo. We walked to Darling Harbour to see the Reptile Zoo and Sydney Aquarium. My husband and daughter walked over the Sydney Harbour Bridge which they fully recommend. So book online prior to visiting Sydney. The local restaurants are great - a little pricey however worth it. The staff where excellent and provided information whenever needed. There is a pool which was not busy. The shopping is great and local. We loved the place and will return on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Mertion Pitt Street”
Reviews.Author: alanna1622
Reviews.Content: Very nice apparments. I was lucky enough to get a tv in my lounge and bedroom. The one bedroom apparments are on the lower levels, so not as many views. Only a short walk from "town hall' sation and Woolworth store.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent self contained apartments”
Reviews.Author: weirdpie
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street from 28th December 2009 for 4 nights. Understandably rates were higher for the 2 nights closest to New Year, but in general the price for a 1 bedroom apartment was very good value. The room was well equipped and clean. The kitchen was modern with fridge, microwave, kettle, toaster and dishwasher. The living area was comfortable with AUSTAR TV and DVD. The bathroom was smart with good water pressure. The room also had a laundry cupboard with a washer and dryer and the bedroom had a flat panel TV. The building had a swimming pool and spa but with Sydney outside the front door we didnt have time to explore them. The concierge was excellent and very helpful, they were happy to offer advice and make bookings on our behalf including our airport transfers. Finally the location (for the money) was great - 8 minutes walk from Darling Harbour and less than 20 to Circular Quay. There were plenty of food shops (including a large Woolworths) very close by for groceries, and cheap places for breakfast or dinner. Later on in our trip we stayed at the Swisshotel round the corner in Market Street, suffice it to say that as nice as Swisshotel was, when we return to Sydney we will be staying at Meriton Pitt Street. Its a lovely slice of city independence.

Reviews.Title: “The pits on Pitt Street!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luigi2008
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this review is based on our experience in a 1 bed appartment. There are some excellent reviews on here based on larger appartments which are higher up in the building which I'm sure may have been a lot nicer. Right now to our experience. We were here on our honeymoon, and for our first Xmas and new year in Sydney. The reviews on here were very good so we based our booking on this, but the hotel fell short in so many ways. Apparently 1 bed appartments are not any higher than the 34th floor, so forget about all the amazing views people have commented on, please do not expect any of this in a 1 bed appoartment. On arrival we were given a 1 bed appartment on the 34th floor. What a treat we had in store, when on turning on the tv, we found a lovely porn dvd playing in the dvd player from our last guests, oh how generous of the hotel. Our room was also overlooking a big vent, which you could here at all times, but the noise magnified if you ventured out onto the balcony. Our room was also quite clearly a disabled room, with handrails on the toilet and the sink being below my waist. There was also no bath (but apparently this is not something they guarantee on booking your rooms). The rooms were also not cleaned well at all, each time our towels were changed they were replaced with dirty towels with lovely stains on. We returned from the beach one day early on in the stay so were a little sandy, and this sand remained on the floor for a further 4 days! We complained to the staff, who were not interested in the slightest, telling us this was not a disabled room and not even offering us any explanation or apology for the porn dvd (perhaps it was one of their own?). The manager on duty handled the situation very poorly, not offering any apology but sticking to the hotel line (some customer service training here would have been useful for all the staff at the hotel we encountered, except the last manager on the last day who did apologise profusely). They did offer to move us, showing us two of the smallest 1 bed appartments (without balconies) they could find on the lowest floors, and said they would try to move us as soon as possible later in the stay (of course we never heard from them again!). One positive is the location, as everything is within easy walking distance from the hotel, and Town Hall station just 2 minutes away. But there are lots of apparthotels on Pitt Street, which have exactly the same location, so this should really be a given. With the poorest service anywhere on our month trip of NZ and Oz, I would not reccommend these appartments to anyone staying in Sydney. Sydney on the other hand was stunning!

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate excellent location”
Reviews.Author: steadlynn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the merriton on Pitt Street for 4 nights during 4 week visti to Australia. Merriton were excellent apartments, very clean and spacious. More than we could have bargained for paid aproxx Â£85.00 per night for 2 bedroomed apartment to sleep 4 adults so at Â£20.00 each per night excellent value. All facilites provided including microwave. washer. dryer etc. Dont use the hotel phone it is really expensive, but normal for hotels. Find time to visit pool and jacuzi small but nice and clean, if you ring receptionthey will bring you extra towels Lovely and clean, nice and quiet with 2 x balconies giving good views over city. Would recommend whilst you are there doing the following. Blue Mountians - Use activity tours, good value small mini bus tour with excellent guide, small company family fun and very friendly Visit to Manley - Get the ferry from Circular Quays and spend the day there, you get excellent views of bridge and opera house, no need to do boat tour if you do this. Get the bus or a taxi to Bondi and do the walk from Bondi to Coogie Beach. Start at the back of the icebergs to the right of Bondi as you look at the sea. Good walk takes a couple of hours but excellent coast walk, call off in one of the bays and have some lunch. If you want to splach out visit the summitt resteraunt for a meal lovely food and resteraunt rotates so get full view of the whole of sydney skyline Have a couple of cocktails then a meal on darling harbour on a evening lovely views and atmosphoner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for our 3 nights in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: djcj
Reviews.Content: Superb 2 bed appt. Clean & everything worked and was as described. Very helpful reception. Ideal for sight seeing. I booked in May and got a very good deal for our stay in November. Secure accommodation with second to none facilities. One of the best accommodations we've had in a city by far. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: smiffy72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2009. What a shock when on arrival the Manager stated we'd been upgraded from our 2 bed appt to the Penthouse suite on the 51st floor. Wow....talk about living like Royalty for the 3 nights we were there. The location is also great and is approx 10 min walk with young children to Darling Harbour and about 15-20mins to Circular Quay. Can on recommend the appt's and will definitely return (even though we may not get upgraded again)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, stylish, and well located”
Reviews.Author: BWUK
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with these very stylish apartments. I booked a 2-bedroom apartment, and on arrival I discovered a well equipped, spacious, and stylishly decorated apartment on the 48th floor. There were two balconies - one in the master ensuite bedroom, and one in the living area. There was a work desk, dining area, kitchen area, utility room, second bedroom, and main bathroom. The apartments were very clean, and with all the conveniences and equipment we could have wished for. The views were also spectacular, right the way to the Darling harbour, and downtown to the harbour bridge. The location was also excellent - a monorail stop is right outside the front door, and the 'Town hall' underground stop is immediately underneath the building, accessible by walking around the corner. The staff were very helpful, and efficient whenever we needed them. The quality and style of these apartments was fantastic, and excellent value. This was the perfect base for a city-based holiday, and a perfect end to our Australian stay. It's possible to see both Bondi and Manly beaches, using the train or ferries from Circular Quay, and still return for a home-cooked meal back at the wonderful apartment. Highly recommended - I wish we could return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Love Loved Love!!! I could stay in for the whole day!!”
Reviews.Author: rihyy9
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again when I come to Sydney. The three bedroom is very roomy, with large, comfortable beds. There are 2 bathrooms, with 1 in the master bathroom. Nice a/c. Very close to monorail station and city rail station, as well as main shopping malls. Downside is parking fee of AUD 35, quite expensive. Manager at reception is not that friendly. Other than that, loved this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Number #1 in Sydney .. best place to stay with a family”
Reviews.Author: Limar
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights with 4 adults and 1 toddler. It was almost like being home. Apartments were huge, great views, clean. We did not encounter any waiting at the lifts as others described.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: Smokey97
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews for hotels but I was blown away with these apartments. The pics on the website were fantastic and I've fallen foul of that trick a few times, but these lived up to the expectation. It's an excellent location with a short walk to the main shopping area and a medium walk to Sydney Harbour. I'd specifically asked for a room high up as other reviewers had mentioned lower rooms were prone to noise. They didn't disappoint. We were on level 39 (which was actually 28th floor as there is a sub car park of 10 levels). From our balcony (which was a little small) we had views of the Tower and could see The Harbour Bridge. We had 2 bedrooms which were both large, loads of cupboard space, a fitted kitchen, laundry room, dinning area and sitting area. The main bedroom was en-suite and included a flatscreen TV. The apartment was kept lovely and clean with a daily service and ample towels, toiletries, tea, coffee, milk, washing up stuff. There's an indoor a tad cool for my liking but once in a swimming you soon warmed up and a spa pool. The only downside and it was a minor one was that the lifts were a little bit of pain. Sometimes they were spot on, you'd press the button and they'd come straight away, but other times they would just go straight past and you had to wait a few minutes, a little frustrating. Oh and the monorail ran outside the hotel with a station just a short walk away. Staff were really helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of everything”
Reviews.Author: shaneandhelen02
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the Meriton Pitt St in a 3 bedroom apartment on the 47th floor. Booked early and got a great on line rate which saved us a lot of money. Place was clean and tidy water pressure was really great and being self contained and with a Woolies supermarket just around the corner this made travelling with a baby a lot easier. Fantastic views from the balcony of Centre Point tower, Pitt St Mall & catching glimpses of Sydney harbour as well as looking out across Hyde Park toward Kings cross. Cafe Doppio across the road does great coffee and panini and the train station is round the corner. Pitt St Mall, Hyde Park all within walking distance and if you can stand to walk for 20 - 30 mins the ferries and Kings Cross aren't far away either. Really enjoyed our stay here may only one complaint was that housekeeping didn't vacuum the floor every day but we asked the guys at the desk to arrange it for us and when we got back it was done. We would definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: love2travel019
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the Meriton and would certainly recommend it to others and definetly stay there when in Sydney again. Really comfy bed and great facilities,we were surprised at how good it was for the price as it's much cheaper than other inner city accomodation. Not much of a view from our room though. Staff were also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Osprey321
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for 7 nights in a one bedroom apartment and were really disappointed. Although the apartment had a comfy bed that's where it ends. The apartment itself was really small. The couch was as hard as a rock, bathroom tiny with no bath and absolutely no view at all even though we were on the 25th floor. They advertise foxtel Tv but don't have fox 3 sports and no movie channels unless you want to pay for one. The dining table fitted two dinner plates but nothing else and you had to sit sideways at the table. I asked for a balcony which was basically non existant and had no furniture . Reception staff always had their heads down and never acknowledged us.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views from 41”
Reviews.Author: stumble
Reviews.Content: Booked accom for trip to Opera house to see 'Mikado' in Oct 09. Had 4 teenage girls as well as my partner and I, so booked 3 Brm Apartment. Check in was easy and room was north facing on 41st floor. views were Kings Cross /Darlighurst, Fort Denison, Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour. Spectacular. Bedrooms were spacious, and two bathrooms was essential with this many females. Location page on Merition website provided maps and directions that were so easy to follow, although the car entrance is not in Pitt St, and i agree frontage is verty tiny and not prominent. Location to shopping, food etc is absolutly central. Train stations and Monorail also available within 5 min walk. Kitchen was great and we actually cooked breakfast each day , overlooking the two harbours Sydney and Darling. If there was a slight downside it was waiting for the lift, but that was due to the place being so popular that I think most of NSW were staying there as well . Price was excellent when calculated on a per person basis, less than $ 75 per person per night. Seriously, if you are looking for Value, Location, roomy, and views..... this is it.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: to_there_and_back
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. We had arrived early from the airport and the staff alerted housekeeping to try to make our room available as soon as possible. When we got back from sightseeing, we thought we were checking in to a 1 bedroom apartment but were surprised to find out that we had been upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment that seemed new, fresh, clean, and had a SPECTACULAR view. It was the perfect ending to our 2 week vacation! We even came back one night to find all of our dishes washed. The location was perfect, too -- about 10 min walk to Darling Harbor and 20 min to Circular Quay, near many shopping malls, but most important a few blocks down from Din Tai Fung, which had the best dumplings I have ever had! We ate their twice because it was so delicious! The only thing that I was disappointed about was the airport shuttle service the hotel uses for their customers. It was $14/person which we thought was a good deal, but the driver arrived more than 30 minutes late (seemingly because another of the tenants was leaving for the airport then and they didn't want to have to send 2 drivers). He also did not even bother to drop us near our airline at the terminal and told us to just walk the rest of the way instead even though it was at the other end of the terminal and he was going to drive by it anyway. Once we tried to check-in for our flight, they told us that it had been cancelled and they had booked us on an earlier flight. Because we had arrived so late, though, we missed that earlier flight and were very close to not being able to go home on other flights that day. The hotel is around the corner from Town Hall train station and goes to the airport on the green line. Costs about $15.60 one way/person. That might be a better option than having to rely on this shuttle service. I can't say enough about the hotel, though -- wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Pitt - It ain't the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterMum09
Reviews.Content: Hello, We've just returned from a 1 night stay in a 2bd at the Pitt, and I must say I was disappointed overall by the experience. It certainly wasn't 5 star. We arrived at about 9pm, and missed the building the first time we drove by because it had a rather small sign out front. When I mentioned this to the manager, he first said that the size of the sign wasn't his responisbility, and secondly, "We're a 50 story building, pretty hard to miss." Well, that didn't give me the warm fuzzies! The apartment itself was fine, albeit on the small side, decor was very nice, but a few small problems. Despite being on high floor, we had little view. In fact, the bedroom looked directly onto a wall. The a/c was incredible noisy - a high-pitched whine-in the 2nd bedroom. Also, the smell emanating from the drain in one of the showers reminded me of a common smell in hotels in Jakarta - dirty, pooled water. So, while overall, it was comfortable night, the lack of customer focus and the noisy aircon made us think that we wouldn't come back here again. Instead, we'll stay in a 2bd at the Hyde Park Inn - not quite as flash, but with free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accommodation in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Clarey73
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Meriton Pitt Street in a studio apartment. The room was very nice, all nice fittings. The bed was very comfy and there was a separate lounge/TV area with a small internal laundry and an ensuite shower room in the apartment. The kitchenette facility was very good with a good size fridge. The whole apartment was very well appointed and very relaxing. There is a gym and a swimming pool/sauna for use also (the pool was nice). I really liked the accommodation, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, very clean and fresh with all conveniences.”
Reviews.Author: webserve
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in our 2 apartments. Both very clean and comfortable. One apartment had one bedroom with ensuite as well as a separate powder room with the second toilet. The living area, kitchen was spacious with modern equipment and polished tiles. The laundry was compact but efficient. We had an EXCELLENT stay with great value at $210 per apartment. Hope they keep up their excellent standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart apartment”
Reviews.Author: andenhalDurham
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my two daughters who are in their twenties. Certainly the best accomodation we had in Sydney. Lovely comfortable beds, Tv's in the bedrooms, ensuites etc, however; they do seem to have a problem with the drains! The smell coming from our kitchen sink was something you don't expect from such a lovely apartment. Quite offputting when you are trying to cook Apart from that everything was fine, toiletries in the bathroom, lovely furnishings, Amazing views. Saying that I dont think I would book again unlless I was assured the problem of the drains was resolved

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTraveller04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a one bedroom apartment for my honeymoon over New Years 2008/9. Awesome hotel. Great location. We were quite high so didn't get street noise. The view from our balcony stretched from Darling Harbour to Kings Cross. Great bathroom. Nice pool area. Had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, great location”
Reviews.Author: rbok002
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and tidy, and I had everything I need in the room. Location was handy, right next to the monorail station and subway station 50m away. I thought the balcony was very small, (Actually no balcony) and the view wasn't so nice. Also the lifts took forever to come. Waited for like 5 minutes for one lift. The internet in the internet room wasn't working when I tried to use it. The front desk offered no assistance to my problems which I thought was quite rude. I did get my money back though. Overall I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best pkace youll ever stay.”
Reviews.Author: bwistle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in a 3 bedrrom, 41st floor, best place I've ever stayed, was right in the CBD, close to every thing, train station which gets you to Bondi very easily. staff friendly and rooms are massive, very clean and modern, beds made every day, and they even put the cleaned the didhes while your out, It had a great view out across the city and to the harbour, and it was for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: gran42
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 8 days at Meriton Pitt St. Booked it after reading reviews on trip watch. We had a 2 bedroom apartment with 4 single beds, 42nd floor, booked at a very good rate 3 months in advance. Excellent views, no delays with lifts, aboslutely every thing we wanted and more. Staff were helpful and polite, pool and spa clean and warm. will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magic stay at the Meriton”
Reviews.Author: Rocket1888
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were on our honeymoon - which the hotel had been advised about - so think thats why we had such a fantastic apartment. We were on the 48th floor - so far enough away from the noise at street level and we had fantastic views of Sydney. The apartment was very modern, spacious and clean. The location was great too, very central for everything. If I return to Sydney I would definately go back to this hotel (hopefully same room).

Reviews.Title: “great value for money and top location”
Reviews.Author: BeijingAussieinchina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in a one bedroom apartment after reading a lot about different serviced apartments and hotels. I usually stay at hotels, like the Hilton, but I wanted more space and freedom to prepare my own foods and not be cooped up in a hotel room. It was a great choice. The apartment was spacious, clean, well-appointed and well-located. I didn't have a view but that didn't matter. Check in was efficient and not fussy, which was refreshing! It is located around the corner from an access to Town Hall Station and two supermarkets, and is right in the middle of Sydney's shopping district. The hotel had a small gym that is in need of some updating, but otherwise the property suited my needs very well, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Beautifully Appointed”
Reviews.Author: SuziiW
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Meriton on Pitt Street - time before was 2 years ago when as 2 families we stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment - we were not disappointed. It was just as good this time with a 2 bedroom apartment for my family. Why would you want to stay in a hotel room and pay twice the price. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, 2 TV apartment and it was just fantastic. Beautifully equipped kitchen, bathrooms and really comfortable beds. The bath tub was like a swimming pool in depth! Also has an indoor pool and games room. The hotel has a non party policy as well so it was really quiet. The other thing I love about the Meriton on Pitt is the location â€“ 2 blocks to David Jones, Myers and shopping precinct, 2 blocks the other direction to Chinatown. One block to a monorail station to get to Darling Harbour, walkable to the Australian Museum and the Quay. It is just really central. Next time we are back in Sydney and want to stay downtown we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT.....WILL BE BACK SOON!”
Reviews.Author: Lavender2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all class. The service was great, the location fantastic and the room absolutely beautiful. It was also very quiet and the furnishings were very plush and comfortable. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a little luxury and a relaxing stay in the city of Sydney. Other establishments should take a good look at this hotel....they could learn a lot. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: penjack
Reviews.Content: upon arrival unable to locate parking garage but found it eventually.checked in to room and was very surprised wth the layout and size of the 2 bed/2bath apartment.we thouroughly enjoyed our 1 night stay glad we went for the late checkout though would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Trendy Apartment”
Reviews.Author: ltrott
Reviews.Content: Great apartment in a very good location. Everything was in walking distance. Stayed in a studio very spacious. Extra bonus was the washer and dryer and cooking facilities. Would recommend highly. First visit to Sydney and found apartment in very good condition in terms of cleaniness. Staff were very helpful as well. Loved it. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: jillofthesea
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one short night on our way home. We would loved to have stayed for longer! The studio apartment was huge, immaculate and very comfortably and stylishly furnished. Bathroom was shiny. No complaints at all about the lifts unlike some reviewers... they always came promptly. Staff were polite and helpful. The location was also fantastic - just opposite Town Hall Station, in the middle of the city. Great place and I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: oregonsisterstravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 2 nights, passing through Sydney. We had a three bedroom apartment to accomodate our extended family group. The rooms were on the 48th floor and had a fabulous view of Sydney. Rooms were clean and had everything we needed. Two subway stops withing 2 blocks. Easy walking distance to The Rocks, Darling Harbor, Botanical Garden, etc. We didn't expect housekeeping to be done since it was a serviced apartment but we came back to cleaned bathrooms and made beds. Staff was efficient and helpful at the front desk and helped arrange a shuttle to the airport for us. We would gladly have stayed a week or more here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elvie3
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on out first trip to Sydney. The hotel was easy to find (Thank you Google Maps!) The staff member at the front counter was couteous and professional. We got there at 12pm and our room was ready. We got to our room ( 2 bedroom on 35th floor) and were just blown away! We were so happy and it was so perfect! The apartment is so big and clean and view was AMAZING! Our room was serviced every day. Housekeeping even did our dishes and had folded up a few items of clothing we had left on the bed, and placed them on the chair! We thought that was a really lovely touch! When we had the balcony doors open street and air con noise was heard but didn't bother us at all. When the doors were shut all we did hear were sirens, that wasn't a bother either. I have trouble falling asleep with inconsistent noise but had 3 nights of great uninterrupted sleep. A light bulb had blown and we told reception on our way out. We got back about an hour later and the light had been replaced. We didn't have to wait long at all for the lifts. The longest we waited on Saturday night was 5 minutes and we didn't have to wait at all on Sunday morning upon checkout. Just a tip, try to get a north facing room. You get a great view of Sydney Tower and Darling Harbour. Loved our experience here so much, we are staying in this hotel again when we visit Sydney again in 4 weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Like home only better”
Reviews.Author: romaromer
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay was so much more than we could have imagined. especially given the price. The two units we occupied were so beautifully appointed and had so many conveniences you appreciate after a long day of playing tourist. The staff bent over backwards to assist with anything we requested and the security made it easy to allow 2 young teenagers some amount of freedom. The location also allowed a quick trip to Woolies for supplies or to one of the many restaurants nearby for a meal. We will all be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but be prepared to wait...and wait”
Reviews.Author: slayme
Reviews.Content: The Meriton Pitt St is in a great location and the rooms were nice and well equipped for cooking. We did have a few gripes, the first being that the wait involved in catching the lifts. We were lucky since we were on the 20th floor and could easily take the stairs (only 9 flights to ground level). However, anyone with kids,, luggage or any sort of physical limitation will find the lifts infuriating. Minutes, as in up to 10 minutes, waiting for the lifts was a common complaint heard from other guests. Gripe number two will sound picky and probably unwarranted; however, one reason we stay in an apartment is that we feel like we're living there (albeit short term). We have never stayed in an apartment where the rooms were cleaned every day. We eventually told housekeeping to wait until our stay was over. The room did seem to let in a lot onot so much from outside noise - it is the CBD so there is noise from traffic but it did not enough to keep us up at night. Despite the comments in the paragraph above, we enjoyed our stay. Upon arrival we discovered our room didn't have a bath. The staff immediately remedied this and moved us to a new room. This absolutely made my stay! Also, be sure to ask for recommendation about restaurants at reception - they will be glad to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great service Friendly staff great location”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMacca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in June & found it to be brilliant. Great location so you can either walk or get the free bus around the city. Woolies is 3 shops away & is opened till midnight each night which is great. The staff are really helpful & got us maps on how to get to certain places in Sydney. The llate security staff are brilliant so if you have noisy neighbours they quieten them very quickly. The place has a zero party policy so you know you can get a good nice sleep. Beautiful new carpet & furniture & a great comfy bed. Would defiantely stay here again.Must go to cupcake shop nextdoor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations. Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: Don35
Reviews.Content: We had a two-bedroom unit. Great location, very clean, all the conveniences you need. Elevators cannot cope with a busy occupancy so there's a wait sometimes. Other than this minor challenge, we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Great and Practical Place”
Reviews.Author: sugarandpups
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Sydney with the family. At first, I was worried doing the booking for Meriton Pitt since I did not get the family's approval. It cost us $38 by cab from the airport to Meriton on a weekday. When we got there, the room was not ready yet so we walked around. Finally, as we entered the unit, the family was shocked at how nice it looked. Cleanliness was our main concern and it was so clean. We got the 37th floor and the master's bedroom had the view of the other building's wall, but it was ok. The light housekeeping done daily included change of towels, and throwing out the trash. Toiletries were also provided daily. It was a little bit cold and had to request blankets. The elevators, which was our main concern after reading all TA reviews, did not give us any trouble at all. It was a good stay overall and we would certainly go back. Woolworth supermarket was just around the corner and we walked to most attractions. Only used the bus once to go to Paddington saturday market.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location”
Reviews.Author: KIRY
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our family in 2 bed apt on 50th flooor, views were stunning, rooms were good size, room service daily, friendly staff , cant wait to go again

Reviews.Title: “Our number 1 pick for Sydney Apartments”
Reviews.Author: nesh78
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom apartment for three adults (one super king and two king singles) off the Meriton website for a fantastically low price of $AU570 for 3 nights. We were astounded when we got to our room. It was huge! The open plan kitchen, dining and lounge had ample space for 3 adults. There was a laundry off the kitchen with full size sink, washing machine and dryer. Beds were well sized and the master bedroom had a good sized ensuite with massive bath. Wraparound deck completed the package. Modern decor and comfortable surroundings. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: QldFamilytraveller
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with Meriton Pitt street. The location was fantastic, was close to transport and supermarkets. The price was very reasonable for a two bedroom unit in the middle of Sydney. We were very high up, so not much street noise. The unit was very modern and had everything we needed. Just a couple of minor things - we couldn't get the heating to work properly and there was always a lengthy wait for lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: carrom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the most charming or characterful I have stayed in but it beats all the others in terms of comfort (2 bedroom apartment), location and price. The rooms were spacious (2nd room on small side) with plenty of storage space, large clean, functional bathrooms, large living area and dining table, big fully fitted kitchen, terrace.
