We had a fantastic washing machine dryer in its own large cupboard with complimentary washing powder. The public areas are nothing to write home about but there is a handy cheap internet room and a good indoor pool and sauna. Staff are reasonably friendly and kept our luggage in storage for us for a week. We stayed on 36th and 42nd floor apartments and they were more or less the same. Views are quite good though no harbour. Some of the furnishings were a tiny bit worn but we were paying $AUS 230 per night for 4 people. A real bargain strongly reccommend! Yes the lifts are still a bit slow.......

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Nikola180
Reviews.Content: The Meriton Pitt Street was an excellent base for our family holiday. We could walk everywhere and the facilities were good for cooking and washing. It was noisey, especially from air conditioning units but its right in the heart of a big city! Indeed as other reviews say the lifts are a problem as the apartments are very busy and there are only three lifts. We enjoyed the pool, sauna and spa area. The view from our balcony was good.

Reviews.Title: “Defintely recommend the Meriton”
Reviews.Author: teresha
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 3 bed apartment for 4 nights during Easter break with 3 adults, a 12 year old, 5 year old, 2 year old and baby. The apartments are huge and perfect for a family, the views were to die for. We were on the 42nd floor (really the 31st as the ground floor is the 11th - go figure) and had views of Hyde Park, Darling harbour, Harbour Bridge, the city, Sky Tower and more. The furnishings are basic but very nice and the place was spotless with fresh towels and little toiletries brought in daily as well as rubbish emptied daily and basic tidying done. Other than that you have to do your own cleaning but that's fine and to be expected with an apartment. The dvd player was a huge plus with little ones and we rented dvds from the Woolworths around the corner which was also handy as toddlers don't really do well at restaurants so easy access to a proper grocery store (rather than a 7 11) was great. The major complaint was the lift which took forever. It was honestly silly and got to where we would factor in an extra 5 minutes or more just for "lift time". Another complaint is the street noise. Despite being so high up you are right in the middle of Australia's largest and busiest city and so there is a lot going on and you can hear it all through the night. The apartments themselves are quiet and your neighbours are quiet but there is traffic all through the night. It didn't disturb the kids at all but I'm a light sleeper so didn't do well. Nevertheless, it's to be expected in a big city and the location is fantastic, we could walk anywhere even with the little ones. It was literally 5-15 minutes to all attractions so didn't have to do taxis or trains at all (although we still took the Monorail for fun). there is a pool and fitness centre but we didn't use or even look at either. There isn't a restaurant but honestly, you're in the middle of several hundred so just walk out the front door and take your pick. Alternatively, several local restaurants will deliver to the apartments and there is a menu folder in each apartment so you can order take away. As to price, it's expensive by Australian standards but not by Sydney's. So don't compare it to apartments on the Gold Coast but rather to Sydney 4 star hotels in which case it's very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Wibsy
Reviews.Content: We hadn't planned on staying here but to due to a booking error with expedia we ended up at these apartments. The location is fantastic for exploring Sydney. Its a 5-10 minute walk to Darling Harbour, for those that aren't up to the walk or when it rains you're a couple of minutes from a monorail stop that will take to there (although its quite expensive). Circular Quay is a bit further but still very walkable. Pitt Street runs parallel to George Street which is the main shopping area. The Queen Victoria Building is just around the corner and is bursting with fabulous shops for all price ranges and is worth a visit itself . QVB has lots of beatiful original features such as enormous stanied glass windows and as its not like any other shopping arcade i've ever been to, truely spectacular. Within a 5 minute walk there are bus stops for all of the beaches as well. The reception staff will point you in the right direction. Our apartment was clean, roomy and comfortable. There were however four small things that bugged me - 1. We had paid for a 1 bed apartment with kitchen so we could cook some evnings. The room came without a cooker and just a microwave which meant no cooking. Not a massive issue as we ate out instead but they should probably make that clear when booking. 2. The room we rented shared a main front door with the apartment opposite (you do have your own front door as well). This would normally mean great sound proofing but not so here. The person in the opposite room had a habit of coming and going at 6am which meant everytime they shut and opened both doors we were woken. Again, not a massive issue but a little annoying if you are on holiday for a bit of relaxatoin. 3. Our room was on the 19th floor which is actually only around 8/9 floors up. The only issue with this is if you get one of the lower floors they are very dark as all the surrounding buildings are very tall. Our room had a balcony but there were no views at all just more very tall buildings. I guess this is quite often the issue if you're staying in a city. 4. The lifts in this building are a nightmare. They seem very concerned for security for some reason. You flash a fob in front of the keypad in the lifts and they will only take you to your floor. Sounds ok but this means that the lifts won't stop once they've set off. So when they pick people up from the basement, they go past the lobby (where you're waiting) and won't stop until they've dropped the basement people at their floor, it could be 20+ floors up. Then if someone on that floor gets in and goes to the basement, they again won't stop when they go past. So in a really tall building you sometimes have to wait 10 minutes to get a lift. Although I've rated on about these 4 points the apartments were a great base, very comfortable and I would definitely stay there again. As we'd not intended to stay here I'm sure we didn't get the most competitive rate but even so, it was around the same price as a decent hotel and you get lots more room and of course can wash your dirty socks & pants rather than having to pay for them to be cleaned elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not impressed with the room”
Reviews.Author: pride
Reviews.Content: It has been 4 mths since we came back from our stay at the Meriton (29 Dec-03 Jan 09). I was thinking of writing the review, and never get to it, however this is my thoughts of the apartment. We booked a studio apartment. We paid much more then the normal rate as it was new year period. The room was facing a building next door, it was not a pleasant sight. We could even hear guest talking in the balconey one floor down. The couch in the room as an unplesant smell ( stale vomit or somone as pee on it). We inform the front desk, but nothing had been done. They inform us they have cleaned the couch, but I doubt it has the smell was still there. we put up with it, what else could we do in a peak period. We did not have much of a problem with the elevator. The location was very good, walking distance to everywhere. Will I stay there again, maybe in a different room. The staff seems not interested in serving you. We inform the receptionist to book a taxi for us for our early morning flight, but none turn up.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: chchgirl
Reviews.Content: Luggage security not great, we were early so checked in and left our luggage in a store room, with everyone elses luggage, no distinction between bags, we could've come back and taken any bag we liked. We had a three bedroom apartment on the 44th floor, first thing we noticed when we walked in was the huge stain on the carpet in the lounge. Two of us then had showers (in the main and master bedroom showers), the removeable heads flew off and spun around in circles, spraying water everywhere - all they needed were screws tightening on the bracket that held the head on. Had what I am claiming to be the worlds most uncomfortable chair in the lounge, had no padding at all you sat straight on the frame. Rooms were meant to be serviced but we had to ask on the second day for our first service - had EXACTLY six towels for six people, we had to ring and ask for fresh towels after the first night and we ran out of toilet paper. Safe hadn't been reset, we had to get someone to come and unlock it so we could use it. One of the bedrooms had a used sticking plaster on the floor. Views were great but you wouldn't want to open the windows or go out on the (small) balcony as it was incredibly noisy (not the apartment's fault) Elevators also took FOREVER, three elevators for 50+ floors. Beds were comfortable, and room temperature was fine, plates bowls etc were adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: MikeyBikey
Reviews.Content: I've got to echo the positive reviews here. Large apartment, well kept, great location. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: holidaysforeva
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroomed apartment and it was lovely. Very spacious (except for the second bedroom which was a bit on the small side). All amenities and seviced daily even though we had cheap rates. Pool was beautiful. Only complaint would be the unbearably slow lifts. Send someone out early to push the button while you finish getting ready. I'm not kidding you migth have to wait at least five minutes.

Reviews.Title: “We're Thrilled”
Reviews.Author: LAS_Brissy
Reviews.Content: We were only at Meriton Pitt Street for one night but wish it was more. Our experience was nearly 100% positive, from the friendly, efficient and helpful check-in until the cheery farewell. We had a two bedroom apartment and a great rate. We found it very useful to book directly with the hotel as the rate was as good as that advertised on the internet booking sites and we could also ask questions/get a feel for attitude. The unit was spacious, clean and well equipped. We were allowed to check in early, for which we were very grateful. More than anything, though, is the location!! Sure, you can get better views in Sydney (although ours was highly acceptable) but it would be hard to beat the convenience of being in the centre of the CBD and on the monorail line. One thing to note: the ground floor is called floor 11. This means that our suite on floor 31 was actually much lower than you might expect. Still, it was quiet, so not a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Stay!! Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: buttygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in November 2008! After a long haul flight from the UK i was hoping this was going to be a nice apartment to relax in and get over the flight. We arrived late evening and as it was dark and not very well sign posted from the outside so we walked past it!!! I arrived at the apartment and was VERY happy with it! Everything was spotlessly clean and tidy, it was spacious and light. The deco was smart and modern and the kitchen was very clean and well equipped for what we needed! (Esp as we decided to cook breakfast at 4.30am).. There was everything you needed for a cuppa when we arrived, although the coffee wasn't very nice so if you have a favourite brand maybe you should pick up a jar on your way through pitt or george st as there are plenty of shops that are open all night. I think the tea was twinnings!! This apartment block had a sauna, swimming pool and gym and they all looked modern and very clean. I can't comment anymore on these as i didn't actually use them as i was too busy exploring the city.. The balcony had really comfy chairs and the view of Sydney light up at night was amazing.. From here we had full view of the Sydney Tower, which is worth a trip up as the views are fantastic!! This is an ideal place to stay as it is really near the train station (called town hall station i think) and from there you can jump on a train for a short trip to get to the harbour bridge and opera house!! There is also so many different places to get food from and the choice is unbelievable!! Pizza hut is not far and for about $14 you can eat what you like, including dessert! and they do a mean chocolate cake :-) The apartment was equipped with a combi washer/dryer which i could get to work so i had to rely on my butty to work it, ( and as he is a man it was a little embarressing..lol) i had an amazing stay here and would recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pity about the noise.”
Reviews.Author: naasboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton serviced apartments on Pitt St, Sydney, for 5 nights in December 08. The location is great: within walking distance of central sydney attractions and shopping, and less than 5 minutes from the trains. The apartment was spacious and reasonably well equipped (except for mismatched and inadequate glasses and plates). Three issues: 1. the sofa bed was possibly the least comfortable bed I have ever slept on; 2. the level of external noise (traffic, sirens, airconditioning units etc) made sleep difficult; and 3. the elevators have to be among the slowest I have ever experienced, average wait for an elevator was at least 5 minutes, and the record in our 5 days was 12 minutes! (I'd read in other reviews that the elevators were a problem, but it has to be experienced to be believed!) An ideal facility for a family with the flexibility of an apartment rather than a hotel room and the location is difficult to beat for convenience. Just be sure to bring ear plugs to drown out the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and superb location”
Reviews.Author: Gervong
Reviews.Content: We were a couple with a 18-month baby and stayed at the Meriton Pitt St, a one bedroom apt during Christmas for 3 nights, and it was a very good stay. It was very clean, modern, and at a great location. Restaurants and shops are all within walking distance. The staff was very helpul in providing information. Circular Quay is at 15-20 min by walking or 5 min drive. Darling Harbour and Chinatown at 10 min walk. We did not even need a car to go everywhere. The kitchen was fully equipped, in the bedroom, the bed was king size, there was a safe box, and in the bathroom, all towels, soap and paper toilets were supplied. My only complaint was that I booked the room 2 months before our arrival and requested a room with a view of the TV tower and Harbour, but were given a room with a building view instead (just in the front). So, we had to put the curtain all the time in order to have some intimacy. But it was not a big issue for us. All the rests were perfect. I would recommend this service apt to my friends and would definitevely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: uscnavyguy
Reviews.Content: Thought that the hotel was OK. It was clean and had everything that a serviced apt has. No problems there. We booked on the Hotels website and that is where the problems started. We never recieved a confirmation. This caused some confusion as there are three Meriton Apts within 4 blocks of each other. The staff at the reception were very cold, not impolite. Of note was that the parking garage was the worst laid out I have ever seen. Parking was 8 levels down and the parking garage was very difficult to navigate in. Not much clearance to turn in and very narrow turns. The worst problem we had was on check out. I made the reservation online for 4 adults and 2 children. There was no clear distinction that if you used the sofa bed, provided standard in the two bedroom apt, you would be charged and extra $50 / night. If we knew this we would have booked somewhere else. This made the rate very expensive. I don't mind paying for services but I like to know what is being charged up front. When I asked the reception staff about this they said it was very clear in their terms and I should have known I would be charged if I used the bed. We were not being charged for the kids, just the fact they used the bed. The staff was not very cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Quality apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: theheadland
Reviews.Content: Great apartment with quality furniture, linens and kitchenware. Good soundproofing from city noise. Supermarkets, Restaurants, Cinemas, Mall, Station, everything within a block. And great views, apartments also have balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Flash and affordable”
Reviews.Author: kiwidive
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and both times thoroughly enjoyed it. The appartments are very clean and tidy and extremely well-equipped for self-catering. Staff were great when we needing anything, including bringing us more wine glasses and plates when we were entertaining friends for dinner. We stayed in a 2 bedroom appartment which was spacious with 2 balconies and also had a bath! Very luxurious for the price. Some rooms have a view of the city and harbour but we were satisfied with a street view - for lovely views we stay in the tropics :) As others have said - the lifts do take a long time but it was a minor irritation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Meriton”
Reviews.Author: Ewoker
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the property overnight but was very impressed with this property. It was in the middle of the city and close to everything. I stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment and it had all the modern facilities such as kitchen, bathroom, washing machine etc. The bed was comfortable and plenty of storage for your cloths. Definately recommend this place if you plan to stay for more than a few nights. The property was also very clean which impressed me. There is a Woolworths that is 2 minutes walk away if you want to buy groceries and if you want to eat out there are plenty of cafes and restaurant which are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Merriton Apartments”
Reviews.Author: LV_Brian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Merition Pitt Street while visiting Sydney with my wife and three teenagers. The location was perfect you could walk to most of the sights and the train station was a very short walk. With all the glass, the views of the CBD from the apartment were excellent. The apartment was clean and pretty well equiped. The staff was very helpful. It was nice to be able to save a little money by having a few meals at the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we were floating in the sky/fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Desigal7
Reviews.Content: We were 4 people, 2 adults and 2 kids (age 9 & 12). We got the 31st floor. The outside walls were all glass. We felt like we were floating in the air. The aprtment was great. Loved the kitchen and the laundry faciilities. The location was great and in the middle of everything. Don't take the rail/metro pass. Better off walking everywhere including Darling Harbour and Circular Quay/Sydney Opera House. The best part is the location of all the restaurants. Shop at the woolworths (in the basement) at the end of the block. Great groceries and souveniers there and across the street. The security is not as good as I would like it. Too many people hanging out in front of the door at night wanting you to let them in when you opened the door. They looked like college students travelling. Still felt safe though. Helped us get a cab to the airport. Cost savings over getting 2 hotel rooms. Also could wash your clothes and have some meals at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent views - recommended”
Reviews.Author: screenname91
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton in Pitt Street with 4 other family members so had an apartment. The location is great - we walked to Darling Harbour and the Rocks, but the monorail line is close by so you can always catch that. The Town hall stop is very close too, so you can catch the airport train - we didn't do that as we had too many people to make it worth while - taxi cost about $50+ from the airport. The following review only applies to the apartment we stayed in - I don't know about any others: The view we had was great - glimpse of the Harbour Bridge, Anzac (?)bridge, AMP tower, Kings Cross Coca-cola sign, Hyde park. Lots of places within walking distance for breakfast. And close to main street for catching taxis. The master bedroom is spacious with an ensuite. The two other bedrooms are a good size but we did have to move some furniture out so we could get into one of the wardrobes - all rooms have their own big wardrobes (masterbedroom has a walk-in robe). There are two bathrooms, three bedrooms, lounge and dining area, kitchen, a little office, a laundry, one large balcony and a smaller balcony for one of the bedrooms. The place was clean. The beds were made daily and toiletries replaced. There were enough towels, but they weren't replaced daily so when we took them to the pool we would wash them in the apartment laundry ourselves. As with most hotels, in my experience, there was never enough toiletpaper, but we just bought our own from the Woolworths nearby - stayed open until midnight every night we were there. The facilities include a pool, spa, sauna, gym - 2 treadmills, 1 cross trainer, 2 bikes, weight station machine and some mats - cannot remember anything else - tv and water fountain in there too. The carpark for hotel guests is right at the bottom and you need to drive down a tight spiralling road to get there, so be prepared to get dizzy. The elevator does take forever as it skips levels even though they are on the way. If you are waiting in the lobby to go up, it can be quicker to catch an elevator going down. I tested it - I went down to the car park, then beat my family going up to level 41 as the elevator didn't stop at level 11 (lobby) on the way back up. One odd thing - the apartment could sleep 6, but there weren't enough coffee cups or glasses for everyone - guess previous guests broke some and they were never replaced. The kitchen had most things that you needed (no frying pan though) - microwave, fridge, stove, cooktop, dishwasher, toaster, kettle, and even a garbage disposal unit. There was tea, coffee and sugar. Overall - would recommend it and would definitely stay there again if travelling with a group.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CaptainMicky
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Meriton and found the location a perfect base for sightseeing Sydney. The staff were pleasant, the hotel clean and our spacious two bedroom apartment offered city views and glimpses of the harbour. As we settled in we were disappointed to discover that the lounge only offered seating for two, the TV reception was poor and the remotes weren't working, one half of the full width lounge window was missing its curtain, there was insufficient crockery/glassware for three people and a very nasty odour emanated from the laundry drain. In addition, the apartment was serviced only once during our stay. I accept that these are all minor things, but we expected so much more from a five star property! The Meriton Pitt Street has many excellent features, but based on our experience, we would be unlikely to use the property again.

Reviews.Title: “All good but the a/c”
Reviews.Author: adelaide20
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and 3 boys in 48th floor 2-br apt for 4 nights in Aug 08. Great room, view, service. Lifts not a big problem. Liked the pool. Spa on the cool side, same as all Aussie hotels I've been to. The one issue? Reverse cycle a/c works fine but goes off after 4 h no matter what. We were there during cold snap, so we went to bed warm but woke up at 5 am shivering. After 4 nights, we felt as tho we'd been camping--but with furniture, kitchen, TV, and view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Appartment but was Spoiled by Slow Lifts”
Reviews.Author: lig66
Reviews.Content: My partener and I stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street during the begining of June for 7 nights. The room was great (the second room we where given due to issues with the first one ) clean, tidy and speciousMy partner and I stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street during the beginning of June. The room was great (the second room we where given due to issues with the first one) clean, tidy and specious. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment on the 21st floor. We didnâ€™t have much of a view as we werenâ€™t on a higher floor. A few issues we found where that the lifts where incredibly slow 90% of the time. It seemed to dodge our floor several times during the day we had to leave about 10 - 15 minutes early (if we made plans to go out anywhere) due to the slow lifts. It was a hassle. Another issue was the room service seemed to occur during the middle to late afternoon most days which meant we couldnâ€™t go into our appt at that time. After a long dayâ€™s walking around town all you want to do is relax in your appt a bit hard when your not allowed into it! (But only for a short time) I guess itâ€™s due to having so many apartments to clean. I would like to question their king size bedâ€¦â€¦ Last time I checked I was pretty sure that two single beds didnâ€™t make a king! You could tell there was a join in the middle! On a good note location was perfect only one â€“ two blocks away from Pitt Street Mall, dozens of cafes only a few steps down the road, darling harbor about 10-15 mins walk. Itâ€™s also very close to the Town Hall Station which you can use to get you to Circular Quay and other locations in Sydney. The apartment had a lovely bathroom, great two person bath and great water pressure in the shower. TV had a good channel selection too, which is good for those rainy days. Front desk staff where pretty good when we where there, we found that they where helpful and also friendly. Nothing like what other reviews had stated about them. Over all was a pretty good stay, however I probably would try another accommodation thereâ€™s as plenty to choose from in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value and location”
Reviews.Author: lekkerboat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights midweek during the August Aussie school holidays and paid $225/night for a two bed apartment with great views on the 31st floor. Underground parking was extra. We found it immaculately clean (serviced every day) and very stylish with full kitchen and laundry facilities. A great central location handy for shops, museums and public transport. The heated indoor pool was great but the spa was cold when we were there. The lifts were certainly busy but not a major annoyance. I would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: nzbc
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Close to Chinatown, Darling Harbour and CBD. The Town Hall station is around the corner providing easy access around Sydney. The apartment is clean and staffed by friendly people. Had one minor issue and this was promptly fixed. TV is a wee bit old and a flat screen would be better. They do have I stayed at the 47 floor and paid a reasonable rate for a two bedroom apartment. You get two balconies but it was a wee bit chilly and windy to enjoy in August. Good view of the harbour from this level. The pool is reasonable enough and so is the spa bath. The gym was small but sufficient for the week that we were there. A couple of issues with housekeeping times and lifts. Housekeeping at the 47 level tend to be between 4.30 and 5.30 pm which tends to co-incide with our arrival back into the apartment so a couple of times it wasn't serviced as it was inconvenience to us. They did surprise us on Sunday when they came in at 9am. We said no thanks to the service that early in the morning. The lifts is my biggest annoying issue with the place. They only have 3 lifts and it can take a while to get up or down during peak times (morning and evening). One of them seems to be constantly occupied by house keeping and the other two fuzzy logic. A few times the lift bypass our floor on the way down and we had to wait for another. A couple of times we stopped at least 7 times which is annoying. I've stayed at the Kent St Apartment October 2007 which is a lot better but cost more than Pitt Street. Lift system is better too. So is their flat screen TV. Tip. If you buy weekly rail passes (which entitle you to use the ferries and buses but not the light rail or monorail), take advantage of the buses which goes up and down Gearge Street. It saves a lot of walking and the frequency of bus services is great. For free news entertain, go to the train station after 4pm and get the daily afternoon paper for free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for a family stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: scpops
Reviews.Content: I sometimes take my family on business and although hotels are nice for a short while, anything over 3 days is pushing it (think rich hotel food and expensive laundry bills)and my preferred option is always an apartment with kitchen, laundry and a couple of rooms. The Meriton on Pitt Street is in the Sydney CBD but is close to the Woolworths supermarket on the same block around the corner, Town Hall train station and the monorail which accesses Darling harbour and Chinatown so easily - you would be hard pressed to find such a convenient location for family in the Sydney CBD such as this. The quality of the rooms was quite good, modern and clean. They were not fully serviced daily but they changed the towels and made the beds daily. There were two bathrooms, one an ensuite and a small balcony - all in all v ery pleasant. There is also an indoor heated pool and a gym. I would defintiely stay there again if I am with family, especially children. The only issue is the time it takes to wait for a lift duing 'peak hours', but all in all, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about location, a bit batterd though”
Reviews.Author: hosithoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street in Aug 2008 in a 2 bedroom apartment with a family of for (2 teenagers). We had booked the place via wotif.com for a rate of 225 AUD/night, which is quite o.k. for Sydney. Location is very good, just in the middle of downtown, only minutes away from botanic garden, Darling harbor and the small Chinatown. About 15 minutes walk to circular quay. Pitt Street and George street just around the corner. The apartment has a little terrace (35th floor!) , which might be a horror for people with acrophobia, it must be very nice in summer. Two Metro stations (Museum, Town Hall) only minutes away. Until some time ago the place must have been a starting point for downtown parties, which must have caused problems with other guests. There are lots of notes prohibiting that now - we didn't notice anything like that. Place was quiet - apart from the noises coming up from the street. Apartment looked a bit battered, scratches at the furniture, some stains on the floor. Furniture is rather cheap and simple - rather 3 star than 4 star. * Management helpful - no complaints. * Things to complain about apartment was a bit smelly, obviously due to an over extensive use of disinfectant - don't know for what purpose .. * Value fro Money o.k. - 225 AUD for a 2 bedroom apartment. Go there if you manage to get a good rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: melwar
Reviews.Content: place was great - location good but right in CBD - which is great but busy. Very clean and comfortable except for the couch and the thermostat. It was winter cold - which we knew before we got there. However the thermostat is apparently programmed to turn off every 3 hours - this made it very cold in the apartment. Apparently it was a council bylaw they had to abide by when they built the property. Overall we enjoyed the space and the area.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: dc_irl
Reviews.Content: These apartments are a great alternative to staying in a hotel. We had been on holidays for 2 week so it was great to have our own living area plus a washing machine ! They are very central although not very y near to circular quay [about a 20 min walk]. My only negative comments would be that the lifts DO take forever and the beds were not the most comfortable. Also, if you like a quiet environment to sleep in, then these apartments might not be suitable.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: druscilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bed apartment for the last 5 days of May, and were very pleased with our choice - which was based on numerous reviews on Trip Advisor. The apartment was on the 36th floor and we had a cityscape view, which was great. We left our bags in the lock up area as we arrived early, and then on return later in the day check in was swift and efficient. The apartment swiper key and lift key worked perfectly every time and we never waited more than 3-4 minutes for a lift. The apartment was just as advertised - very spacious, clean and kitchen fitted out very well. The apartment was serviced every day with fresh towels, kitchen linen, toiletries etc and the bed was a superking size and very comfortable. It is very central in the CBD, just around the corner was a Woolworths where we did most of our food shopping and just along the road was the Queen Vic Building. Very easy access from the Town Hall train station, and about a 15 minute walk to Circular Key. We would recommend these apartments for value for money, access to city and sights and had no hassles at all. Only negative was a slightly wonky toilet seat - but as we left a comment about that on leaving would assume it has been fixed. All in all a great stay for 5 nights in a city. Would stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Hideaway in the city bustle”
Reviews.Author: Captainserious
Reviews.Content: At the end of May we required a three bedroom apartment for five adults who were attending a three day conference only a block away from this complex. This Meriton apartment is situated at 327-329 Pitt Street behind the old facade of the YMCA. On arrival everything we asked for was in order. The apartment on the 45 level had a balcony and all the windows were able to be opened. The heated pool,sauna and spa on the 13 floor was spotlessly maintained. Each room had a King bed which was able to be split into two singles if required at booking. The staff on the front office were both pleasant and efficient in their work. Even the after hours security officer was helpful. The five of us could not wish for better!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Angel_ca
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at Meriton Pitt serviced apartments. We were three adults and two small kids. It was a two bedroom apartment with kitchen and laundry. One of our bedroom had a very nice view of the harbour and city. The apartment was clean and spacious. Our kids had lot of space to play and roam around. Since we reached early around 11am, the room was not ready.They have a room where you can leave your luggage and then roam around. Also they have a luggage cart (same as used by bell desk folks). We used that one to carry all our luggage into the room and then dropped it back. There are three lifts and busy all the time. So you might need to wait a bit but lifts work - no issue. Once you come out of hotel from reception, on right there is 7/11 and on digonally opposite corner of apartment is woolsworth - which is cheaper. Do check out QVB right in front of Woolsworth as a hang-out/shopping place.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: ballerina
Reviews.Content: i totally understand all the praise here. we had a 2 bed apartment which had everything we could need. it was totally quiet, clean and comfortable. very close to restaurants, shops and supermarkets. helpful front desk staff. if you are staying in sydney with children (as we did) i would say this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Meriton Serviced Apartments Pitt Street was the pitts”
Reviews.Author: JSoup
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Meriton Serviced Apartments, Pitt Street. We were initially booked into a room close to the ground and asked to move to a room higher up away from road noise. We were put into a room designed for disabled guests. The air con did not work, the dishwasher broke down twice (when it would beap non-stop) and after many promises of the air con being fixed we eventually got upgraded and put into another apartment. In the meantime the remote access for the garage door stopped working on numerous occasions and the person on the front desk on one occasion proceeded to walk my husband to the garage "to show him how to use the remote". Each time it was a problem with the remote rather than our inability to use it (point and press, how hard can that be?). Coming home at 6pm at night to do battle with a remote causing a traffic jam in downtown Sydney, then waiting 15mins for the world's slowest lifts meant we were pleased to see the back of the place. The final straw was Meriton charging our credit card as they have a policy of charging it when incidentals reach a certain level. This policy was never communicated to us and the same guy at the front desk had a crappy attitude about it claiming we "must of been told". Had to phone to request an invoice for this charge as well. For a short break probably ok. Any longer than a weekend avoid. Sydney must have better options than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: suepaul93
Reviews.Content: We had a 3-bedroom condo for 2 families and it was great. The location was walkable to all Sydney sights. The elevators were a little slow as previously mentioned but not unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ch0pper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Great location, great staff and great rooms. The location is central Sydney and you can easily walk to Darling Harbor or to Circular Quay. The monorail is right next to the hotel as well and an all day pass is good value at $10. There are a host of coffee outlets, cafÃ©â€™s, restaurants and bars and importantly as this is an apartment with cooking facilities, supermarkets. The front desk staff are wonderful and helpful. Full of knowledge of their city and what they donâ€™t seem to know they attempt to find our or find for you. The room staff were all exceptionally pleasant and would do small requests straight way (we broke a glass and needed help with the bits and replacement and we needed a room service menu). The main point is how they all seemed happy and that is to me a biggie. There is nothing quite so bad as arriving at the front desk or being greeted by room staff with a morose out look on life it can make a real downer to your day. We used the room service menu a couple of times this is provided by some local restaurants and they were quick, courteous and the food arrived hot. The rooms are big comfortable and well laid out. Might not be as luxurious as the Hilton or Westin but are easy to live in. When I say not as luxurious this is not a slight on the apartments, everything is in good maintenance, clean, functional and very comfortable. There is room to spread your self out and relax. A good size lounge, dinning and kitchen separate bedroom and separate bathroom. The kitchen has all the normal facilities of oven, microwave, dishwasher, cook top and the pots, pans plates, glasses etc you would expect. A decent sized fridge and freezer not one of the little tiny bar fridges. You can get more than two cans of drink into this one. A washing machine and drier are provided per apartment and while doing the washing isnâ€™t high on the agenda when on holiday it means a smaller case while traveling. My children are all grown up but I can remember the days of being in hotel rooms with small children who want to get toys or colouring pens out to play. There was never enough room. The Meriton has that space. The lifts which others have complained about and other residents of the apartments were complaining about are a bit of a nuisance. Best approach is donâ€™t leave it till the last moment if you have to be down on the street at an exact time. Just stroll out and nonchalantly wait the lift will eventually arrive. It gets a bit disconcerting to watch the lifts go up and then go straight past your floor on the way to the lobby. Apparently the lifts are weight rated and when they reach a certain capacity donâ€™t stop at any more floors. Having been told that I appreciated the wait for a lift. How many times have you been on a lift which is full, it stops at another floor and another family believes they can just squeeze in or load several large cases in. Being a bit claustrophobic I worry about the lift jamming though being overloaded so hence I accept the wait for the safety aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartment”
Reviews.Author: Eaglemaniac
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment with my son for 8 nights. The apartment was excellent. Everything we wished for. So much more space than a hotel room. Two train stations and two supermarkets within walking distance. The lifts were a bit slow, but everything else made up for that frustration. I'd recommend it to anyone, businessmen, families etc.

Reviews.Title: “great apartment”
Reviews.Author: Omoishiroi
Reviews.Content: I had a one week business trip to Sydney - wanted to be central and have a washer/dryer, kitchen etc. The Meriton Pitt street is unassuming - unless you had the address you would not it was there - this is not the Westin in terms of entrance and foyer! Nor is it from a front desk perspective - this is more a self service unit than a hotel. My studio suite had a large bathroom - shower only - a galley kitchen, laundry, huge wardrobes and a safe. Maid service was provided daily. The bed was very comf and the unit had a good sized desk - my only complaint about the desk - and this goes for all hotels please listen! - is the lack of plug space. The available receptacle was under the desk and required me to unplug something else if I wanted to plug in more than one item. These days we all have a laptop and a cell charger so why not make it easy by at least providing a power bar instead of having us rummage around under the furniture looking for power? I ended up using the outlet on the stove. Back to the Meriton Pitt - although I was in the CBD and next to the monorail my room was quiet - very quiet. Even the revellers in the streets for Mardi Gras seemed muted. The location is great for business - I attended many meetings and visited many clients and all but one were within a 5 minute walk. Circular Key is maybe a 10 minute walk. There are several places to eat and drink but the higher end restaurants are further down Pitt toward the water. There are many shops and department stores within a few blocks. If you are on a longer stay and want a little more space and things like a small kitchen and laundry and you are willing to fore go typical big hotel accoutrement's I would recommend the Meriton on Pitt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lincs-Honeymooners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street for 5 nights over new year and it was perfect. We weren't expecting such a high standard of appartment with such good views (even though we weren't high up). It was clean and fresh and the staff were exceptionally helpfull. I would definately recommend someone to stay here and we would ceratinly stay here again if we came to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Appartments”
Reviews.Author: slmat22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street (Rialto) for three nights 9th-12th Jan. 2008 in a Studio room and could not be happier! Have stayed plenty of times in Sydney at verious Hotels and was planning on doing this again when I stumbled accross the Meriton Appartments on Wotif. Then did a bit of research on TripAdviser on which property to stay at, in the end we decided to go with the cheaper of the 3. I rang the reservations line and they were able to beat Wotif's price and we got one night for $99 what a bargain!!!! Great room, all that we needed, very modern and better than a Hotel room. No problems with the lifts like others have said, great security, our room was serviced good, and check-in and check-out was fine. Only had a view of the city but this was good! need to book a bigger room to have a better view. Will be staying here again when I return to Sydney, can't beat the location and was able to get a train from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and beatiful views”
Reviews.Author: jupjup
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom service apartment for two weeks. It is very handy as being so close to shopping, train station. The room was very modern and had a beatiful view of city.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved the Meriton Pitt Street”
Reviews.Author: Giggles22
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Meriton Pitt Street are absolutely awesome. They are so helpful and go above and beyond what you would expect them to help you with. We had a great stay at their serviced apartments. The rooms were a great size and very clean. It's also in a great location, close to the shops and city night life. I would definately recommend people to stay at this great place. You'll have a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for children”
Reviews.Author: marywgtn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 5yr old daughter in September, 2007. Room: Fantastic! We had a 1 room apartment on the 28th floor, with a gorgeous view over the city. I had asked for a high level room, and apparently this is the highest level in the hotel that 1 room apartments go (with the surrounding buildings I wouldn't have wanted to be any lower!) . Lots of room, fabulous kitchen, great laundry, really well appointed. Good being able to self cater at odd meal times with an excited & tired 5 yr old. Location: Superb, Literally round the corner and down the street to Town Hall train station, easily walkable (get the airport train to/from the airport, faster & cheaper than a taxi). Walkable or train ride to all major tourist attractions. Two supermarkets very close by, and the heavenly to-die- for David Jones food hall two blocks away. Hotel facilities: As noted by others the spa pool is a tad on the cool side, and the swimming pool is icy! And as noted, the lifts are so slo-o-o-ow..... Others have also noted the unhelpful attitude of the staff. I also thought they were a bit unfriendly until I realised that many of the apartments in the building are privately owned, plus there are office suites in the building. Thus many of the people who go past the front desk are not hotel guests, and hence the staff don't look up and smile at every single person walking by. Having said that, some were a bit brusque in conversations, and small requests, like a bathplug, took a day to attend to. Overall: Great location, great view if you can get it, great facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central city location”
Reviews.Author: annieme
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent a week at the Meriton Pitt Street apartments at the end of September. We were lucky enough to be able to check in on arrival early in the day. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. We had a very spacious and clean 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment on the 42nd floor (not quite high enough to get the view from on all sides but almost!) The apartment was serviced daily. The location was brilliant -- so central! We walked everywhere or used the excellent train, ferry, and monorail services. (Even got the train to and from the airport .) For self-caterers there are a couple of largish supermarkets close by (avoid the so-called convenience stores though unless you want to pay exorbitant prices!) The children loved the indoor pool, spa, and sauna. Other reviews have commented on the slow, infrequent lifts, but we had no problems at all. Would recommend it highly and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: zkdan
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst place I have ever stayed. Not only were the lifts frustrating but the staff we so incredibly rude and unhelpful. After a 2pm check in time, we were finally given a room after sitting and waiting until 330pm. Then, when there was no view from our room, as we were promised when booking, we were told a room with a view would cost us an extra $800AUS. I have attached a picture of our promised city views.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: megalomaniac1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street from Wednesday the 13th of September to the 15th 2007 and was pleasantly surprised by the room. It has all the ammenities such as a kitchen which is hard to find in a hotel these days but is the most important ammenity i search for when booking a hotel. The room was spacious the bathroom was lovely, no shower curtains but actual glass doors!! Very clean and modern and lovely views. The disappointments of this hotel would have to be the people who worked at check in/lobby on the days we stayed. There was never a smile on their face it seemed quite hard for them to do service with a smile i felt bad for even asking for them to hold onto our luggage before check in time because they didn't seem to enjoy doing anything they often seemed reluctant. This dampened our trip a little because it's always nice to be in a hotel where the staff are fun and friendly and happy that you are staying in their hotel. Another problem was the tv reception. Being in the Sydney CBD you would figure that the tv reception would be bright and clear but this was not the case unfortunately. The elevators took a very long time to go up and down which was a pain. Lastly a staff member allowed us to check out an hour after the check out time (as our plane left late) but we had a Meriton staff member come to our room and inform us that we were late with our checkout at 10:30 thus embarrasing us as we would never have stayed late had the lady allowed us to stay till 11.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Meriton Pitt St”
Reviews.Author: austravelAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meriton Pitt St in March 2007, but have actually stayed at this property numerous times in the last few years. Every time, I have found my room to be clean, roomy and very nice (and I have stayed in a mix of different rooms from studio suites to a 2 bedroom apartment). On one ocassion I had a noisy air-conditioner (in one of the studio apartments), but it wasn't that bad and did not detract from the overall experience. I will continue to stay at this hotel on the basis of location, convenience, cost and the room itself. Highly recommended, especially as it is very difficult to find clean accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Hannah48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton for 2 weeks in February 2007. Had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom apartment on the 32nd floor with balcony. Apartments spacious. Fitted kitchen with dishwasher, cooker, fridge/freezer etc. Separate laundry room in apartment with washing machine and tumble drier. Apartments cleaned daily. Sachets of dishwasher powder, washing powder etc left daily by cleaning staff so no need to buy any. The location of the apartments was superb right in the middle of the CBD. Two minute walk to the Shopping Malls, 10 - 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour etc. Train/metro/bus stops just around the corner. Various bars and restaurants in vicinity - eating out wonderful. Try the Meat and Wine Company at Darling Harbour/Circular Quay area. Two coffee/breakfast cafes, one opposite, one next door to the apartment building. Sydney is fabulous, we had a wonderful holiday and would love to go back one day. We would certainly stay in these apartments again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kakkie
Reviews.Content: We selected the Meriton on Pitt largely due to the reviews from this site and I can say without a doubt we were not dissappointed. The Meriton lived up to everything we expected and more. Our two bedroom and two bath was clean, quiet, and very roomy. I now wish I had taken photos of the apartment to post along with this review. Everyone should see the view we had.The next time we are in Sydney we will definitely stay at the Meriton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Apartments - recommended for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: queenjojo02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Meriton Pitt Street (as it now seems to be called) for a girl's weekend on 19-20 May 2007. We were on in a two bedroom two bathroom apartment on the 38th floor (so really the 27th floor). Room 120. The apartment was fantasic. The master bedroom had a spacious adjoining bathroom with a bath and shower (separate). The apartment was very modernly decorated and very comfortable. Fully stocked kitchen with anything you could ever hope to use, plus iron, washing machine and dryer, hair dryer in the bathroom. The balcony was really nice and large and quite a surprise, as I've stayed in the Meriton world tower and the two bedroom apartment there does not have a balcony. The balcony was as long as the apartment, so you could access the balcony from both bedrooms and from the living room. It also had a table and chairs. I know people complain about the lifts but we didn't have any problems..the most we had to wait was 3-4 minutes one time. This building isn't as nice as the World Tower as the apartments are a bit smaller and not as high up. The pool and spa area also isn't as nice. Note to staff - the spa temperature is not hot enough! If you're going to Sydney I would definitely recommend this place. Excellent apartments and the location is fantastic too. The World Tower, while better, is quite a bit more expensive. For the difference in price, I would stay at Pitt Street again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Rialto”
Reviews.Author: FITCHICK711
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice, comfortable stay in a 3-bedroom apartment at the Rialto. We stayed here with my husband's parents and our teenage son. Very spacious, good views and very good location. Kitchen had everything we needed. Didn't have any problems with the lifts at all. My son and his Pop had a great time playing pool at the Rec Room. My mother-in-law had fun and felt very safe shopping on her own sometimes as there were shops everywhere. Sydney Central is just a block away, QVB just around the corner and Woolworths store is on the same block. I had a conference at the Darling Harbour and that is only a 10-minute walk. We used the buses, trains and the monorail and they are all just a few minutes away. Overall, I highly recommend the Meriton Rialto especially if you have a big family and would need a 2 or 3 bedroom apt. I believe the 3-bedroom apts. are higher up and therefore have better views.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious apartments”
Reviews.Author: travitin
Reviews.Content: My stay at Meriton Pitt St was good but nothing special. The location is OK - being in the middle of the central business district but a good 15-20 min walk to Circular Quay which we seemed to walk at least a couple of times a day! The apartments are spacious and comfortable, if a little sterile. The bedroom was large and comfortable but without a TV (there was a TV in the lounge). The bathroom was an odd design - basically one big wetroom which meant that there was water everywhere after showering. The staff were adequate but not particularly friendly or helpful. The room cleaning was fine although they did forget to clean one day - I told reception but they didn't do anything about it. If you are after a romantic meal out you must go to Cafe Sydney - amazing food and setting - one of the best meals I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “The Meriton Pitts on Pitts street”
Reviews.Author: andy_from_africa
Reviews.Content: Room cleaning service was pathetic. Cleaning crew spent 5 minutes cleaning the room and then disappeared. They made up the bed, changed the towels and cleaned out the dustbin. That's it. We have a 3 year old child and during our 5 day stay they did not vacuum the carpets once. Shower or bathroom was not cleaned and soaps or toilet paper replaced. The aircon system is also very noise and the fan speed does not change. It is too noisy and blowing like a wind generator that we had to switch it off at night to be able to sleep. Thanks goodness the evenings were cool enough to leave the windows open. We mentioned this and were informed that this is a problem with several rooms and we could change if we wished. They only good things we have to say is that the location is good. We would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...not the perfect place everyone makes it out to be”
Reviews.Author: stevie_23
Reviews.Content: Well, me and my partner had searched far and wide online and this website for a serviced apartment or our week-long stay in Sydney. We wanted something 4-5 star, in the heart of the CBD and with a proper kitchen and separate living/bedroom areas. We had seen a heap of glowing reviews on the Meriton Rialto (Pitt St), and so felt fairly confident in finally making the booking. Ok, so we arrived and it IS in a really good location. For some reason not even known to myself, I've always preferred the southern end of the CBD (Circular Quay, Wynyard, anywhere south of the Pitt St Mall basically) and so this wasn't QUITE there, and some of the areas around were a little dodgy at night, but there was a Coles and also a Woolworths on 2 corners right nearby, George St where all the buses go from is around the corner...and Pitt St Mall is only like, 2-3 blocks away. It's also quite a lovely 15 minute (but doesn't seem that long) walk to Circular Quay and The Rocks and stuff...so yeah, it really IS a great location. Another good thing is the noise level. Despite being in the middle of probably the busiest city in the country, we really couldn't hear anything much in the day or night...hardly any real traffic noise...obviously if a siren goes off or a really loud truck or something goes by, you'll hear it but otherwise, nothing. There was some sort of protest right outside Town Hall the other day and we heard absolutely nothing! Now, check in went smoothly. We arrived at a very busy time it seemed, as there were a million people stuffed into the foyer, but then luckily most of them were lost and actually wanting one of the other Meritons (very close proximity, the other 2 properties) so they left. When we first went up in the lift to our room on the 25th floor (but not really, as the ground floor is actually the 11th floor for some reason...so we were more like the 14th floor I think), we had no idea the issues and dramas we would have in future with the lifts...I know people have mentioned them in previous reviews, but I never expected what happened... Anyway, so the room was nice, but a fair bit smaller than expected...just based on the website photos and other similar hotels/apartments I'd stayed in (like the Sebel, Quay West, Medina, Quest, etc), and the windows weren't the floor to ceiling ones I'm used to, but small narrow/thin ones...the bedroom was very small (like, when the door wasn't completely open or closed, you couldn't get in the room unless you climbed over the bed) and the cupboard wasn't mirrored, which wasn't a problem except that the only longish mirror was on the wall that when the door was open, you couldn't see, so whenever I got dressed or did my make up or hair or whatever, I had to have the door at least partially closed. This is a minor thing and I wouldn't even mention it except for the other things... The balcony mentioned on the website...well, basically it was non-existent. You could open the door, yes, but we found it quite funny actually, when reading the Meriton information/rules, where it said that if you were going to smoke, you had to do it on the balcony with the door closed behind you. This was amusing because you simply could not do this without plummeting the 14 or so floors to your probable death on the street below. There was no room for even a very thin, small child to fit on this balcony with the door closed. I am a small woman and I had to stand with one leg on the balcony and one leg, and half of my body, in the apartment. So...yeah. I noticed the floors way above had proper balconies though...I guess we just weren't lucky enough to get one of those rooms. The shower door wouldn't shut...the toilet roll holder was bent downward and so the roll, when a full roll, kept sliding off to the floor...and the cleaning staff who made our bed and brought more towels, etc, though lovely, always came at 5pm...which is sort of annoying because it's often a time when you've either just come home from a busy day and you're exhausted and just want to relax, or you're trying to get ready to go out...and sometimes both. We found it annoying that we'd come home sometimes to find people in our room and we'd have to wait around before we could do anything... The air conditioning was so loud we couldn't have it on. It wasn't so much the air itself that caused the noise, but the force of the air, even on a low setting, was so violent that it caused the vents to rattle incredibly loudly and we ended up just sort of being a bit hot and stuffy alternating with a bit cold (the a/c apparently was always on, but just not the fan part which was the loud bit.) On the first night, I noticed 2 mosquitos buzzing around so we killed them. (We had not had the balcony door or window opened at this point. We actually assumed they'd been locked by hotel management, as I was told prior to arriving that they locked the doors on Friday & Saturday nights...we later found this was not actually the case). Later that night, it was about midnight, I was lying in bed kind of daydreaming and noticed an increasing number of small dots on the ceiling above...I sort of wondered what they were, but didn't think much of them as I was tired and sort of assumed they were those little tiny bug flies...they aren't any sort of bother, so it didn't matter to me, and I turned off the light. However, soon enough, after the lights were off, I heard multiple buzzings in my ear, and turned on the lights to see all these mosquitos floating around the room. I freaked out, as I HATE mosquitos and bugs in general. I went to the bathroom, thinking I'd be safe there, but no. Another 2 were in there. The lounge also was home to several mosquitos. I couldn't sleep like that and I was worried they were breeding in the air conditioning or something, so I ended up going downstairs to reception at 1.30am to find out what could be done. I half expected they would let us move rooms, which I wanted (also to get a room with a proper baclony), but they gave me a can of fly spray, which did the trick anyway and thankfully no more mosquitos appeared for the whole week. I don't know how they got in though in the first place. Ok, so the last thing is the lifts...ohhhh, the lifts. The night I had to go down at 1.30am to get the fly spray, I waited...15 minutes for the lift to go down. The next day I was meeting friends who were going to phone me when they were outside for me to come down to bring them up to store their bags in our room for a few hours...they ended up coming up by themselves as I just simply could not get down! I waited over 20 minutes while the 2 working lifts (normally there are 3) just kept going past my floor every single time... Every day, whenever we went out, we would waste over 15 minutes...this added up to about 30-45 minutes each and every day of the week we were there, just hanging around waiting for the lifts!! It was ok going up from reception. They were slow, but just normally slow, not ridiculously slow. It's not just that they're slow, to clarify on others' reviews. I assumed from those that they were just slow because of the number of guests and maybe the lifts themselves were old or something, but noo...they are actually fast lifts. What causes the incredible slowness is the way they are progammed. Most lifts go down from a floor, picking up people who have pressed the button at their floor on the way...but these lifts don't do that. If a lift is 2 floors above you, it'll go right past your floor on its way to the very floor you're trying to get to. Then it'll go up again, also ignoring you, before coming back down again, not stopping at your floor a second time. It is INCREDIBLY frustrating. Anyway, that's it. We did have a wondeful time and overall the Meriton IS a good place to stay. These issues (except for the lift) weren't a big deal, but I wanted to mention them as everyone else seems to think it's this absolutely amazing, perfect place, and in my experience (which may have been bad luck or unusual for the hotel), it just isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: shan31667
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights over Chinese New Year weekend and couldn't pick many faults with the place. Our one-bedroom apartment was on the 20th floor and was on the corner of the building, so we got views from both angles, out both bedroom and lounge rooms. The kitchen and bathroom contained very modern and stylish features, probably the best I've ever encountered in any hotel I've stayed in. The bed was comfortable, however we were only provided with two sheets and no blankets. Even though it was summer, it still was a little cold overnight. The apartment was serviced daily and not until the afternoon, so our sleep was never disturbed. The pool and spa facilities were very spacious, clean and comfortable. Our major problem was with the lift, which had an average wait time of 20 minutes. On a Saturday night at 1am we had to wait 30 minutes as only one lift was working and a cleaner was using it at the time - locking it at every floor he was servicing. Wegot the room at a very reasonable rate considering it was Chinese New Year and it was difficult to book in anywhere. We were overall very happy and would consider returning if we visit Sydney again!

Reviews.Title: “Easily the best place ive every stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: kirsty12345
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week with friends, we had a two bedroom apartment on the 46th floor with views over Darling Harbour. Apartment is simply fantastic, cant fault it at all. If you get a good deal for this id say go for it. Everything you need about Sydney is right on your doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Better”
Reviews.Author: JiminKorea
Reviews.Content: Booked Rialto because of recommendations from this cite and others. We were not disappointed and think most reviews have understated the quality and value of the fabulous Rialto. Staff was always efficient, pleasant and well informed. We stayed for three nights the end of Dec 07. Thirty-seventh floor 2- bedroom/ 2 bath apartment was fantastically large and well-appointed. Fully equipped kitchen, huge master bedroom suite with large soak tub (a real blessing after days of long hikes). Tremendous views of Anzac Memorial and park. Wonderful balconies off of living room/master bdrm and second bedroom. Easy 20 minute stroll to Circular Quay through clean/ safe streets. Ten minutes to Darlington Harbour and the Aquarium. Only ding was on last day when the elevator took twenty minutes to finally stop at our floor. Management says this was caused by excessive numbers checking out that day. When we come back to Sydney, Rialto is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable Sydney Apartments”
Reviews.Author: Memsahib
Reviews.Content: I booked this apartment using [----] and got a really good rate. I only stayed two nights. I found the staff very helpful and efficient. Security was excellent. I was upgraded from a studio to a one bedroomed unit which was very comfortable. Very strict rules about parties and noise. I had a problem with the shower but mentioned it to the reception in the morning and when I returned it had been fixed. Very convenient to everything - a supermarket closeby and lots of restaurants. Monorail station is a two minute walk away and trains close too. Make sure you have the exact address written down as many Sydney cab drivers don't know the apartments. I believe good views from higher floors. One of the few apartments that offers broadband connection and at a reasonable price. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQZA
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with our 2 bedroom apartment on the 38th floor. The views were great, the beds very comfy and the service very good. Even the tub was one of the best ones I've ever had in a hotel/apartment. Didn't even have to wait long for the elevators. It was very centrally located and we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing after Busy Day”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneTravellers
Reviews.Content: We got off to a bad start with but we were upgraded to Penthouse for 2 nights. In all, 7 people in our group stayed at the Meriton Rialto in 2 appartments and all found it not only good value and absolutely no complaints from any of them. We could sit down and have a few drinks after a days sightseeing and relax with no hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments”
Reviews.Author: JasperAubrey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Rialto and really enjoyed our stay. I read most of the reviews on this site and did not experience any of the problems other reviewers complained about i.e. slow lifts and rude staff. The lifts were efficient and we seldom waited more than a minute or two. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful - from the front desk to the domestic staff. We stayed in a 2 bed 2 bath apartment on the 49th floor which had fantastic views from all windows and balcony. The apartment was spacious, clean and modern with great bathrooms. The only negatives were stained carpets (which are about to be replaced) and the most uncomfortable couch I have ever sat on - this doubles as a sleeper couch if needed. One tip if travelling with infants as we did - the hotel has no high chairs or cots but I believe these can be arranged through an external company. The pool and spa were very clean and enjoyable although the pool is a touch too cold. The position is top notch - close to Darling Harbour and China Town. Town Hall station is 200-300m away and from there it is 2 stops to Circular Quay. Overall the Rialto lived up to our expectations in all aspects and surpassed them in others. I would definitely stay there again and recommend them to everyone and especially families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: HUNTINGPARTY
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults 2 children) stayed here for 3 days in July 2006, having found the apartments on this web site. We arrived at about 7.30 am and although we couldn't get to our apartment the reception did store our luggage and were generally very friendly and helpful. We had a 2 bed, 2 bath apartment on the 31st floor and were really impressed. The apartment was clean, well furnished and supplied and in a great location for anything you might want to do in Sydney. There is a Woolworths round the corner for all your shopping needs and a great cafe opposite for breakfast (particularly useful if you are arriving on an early flight). The apartment was serviced every day and washing powder was provided to be used with the washing machines.

Reviews.Title: “The higher, the better.”
Reviews.Author: Welltravelled2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 8 nights July/August 2006. Our stay did not get off to a good start when we arrived around 7.30pm on a Friday night and were given a fairly small apartment on level 23 (ground floor is level 11), on the corner of Bathurst and Pitt Streets. This corner suffers from the obvious traffic noise in a big city, together with the frequent whooshing and clanking of the Monorail which passes below. There is NO double glazing. Along with the noise which kept us awake, we were also sleeping on extremely hard beds! However, as we had prepaid for 8 nights and had, in fact, requested a quiet apartment, we felt that some consideration should be given to our comfort for the remaining 7 nights and the next morning we asked to be moved. There was some initial reluctance, but we were eventually moved to the 35th level, on the side of the building. This apartment was HEAVEN compared to the previous one : only a distant murmur of traffic could be heard. Additionally, the beds were very comfortable in this apartment. The soundproofing between apartments is excellent. We could hear people getting in and out of lifts, but once their apartment doors were closed, not a sound could be heard which was wonderful. This one bedroom apartment was clean with a good sized lounge and good kitchen facilities. Lacking was the provision of bowls for soup/pasta etc. The bathroom basin didn't have a plug and we asked for one, which never materialised. Housekeeping was erratic. Some days dishwashing liquid/powder was left, other days it wasn't, but all in all a reasonable job was done. Rubbish was always removed. As previous reviewers have said, the location is superb - so close to everything. I would stay at Meriton again. I feel that management should ensure that people who have prepaid for a number of nights be allocated the quieter and more comfortable apartments. However, the receptionist advised that the booking system is quite complicated and to ensure you do get the type of apartment requested, it is always a good idea to phone Meriton direct a day or two prior to checking in, to make sure this has been done.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, great location”
Reviews.Author: mitzi57
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a bedroom 2 bath apartment on the 47th floor. We had a large balcony with good views and were almost eye level with the AMP Tower. I found the kitchen to be well equipped and it had a good assortment of pots, pans, dishes etc. The appliances were high quality, new and very clean. You could cook a full meal from scratch if you were so inclined. Housekeeping provided dishwasher powder, dishwashing liquid and laundry powder on a daily basis. The apartment was very spacious and the furnishings were in good condition. The master bedroom was large with an extremely comfortable bed, large closet with mirrored doors and a balcony. The connecting bathroom featured a deep, jetted tub, a separate shower with a glass enclosure and a large sink and vanity. The second bedroom had 2 twin beds and a large closet. The second bathroom was similar to the first except there was no tub. We had ample towels and didn't need extra blankets. Bathroom toiletries were replaced daily. If you need/want the Internet, you can get a high speed connection in your room for an extra $15.00 per day. The fitness room was small but adequate while the pool, sauna, and spa were large and clean. There is also a computer room with 3 computers near the pool area. We didn't get to the games rooms. The elevators were speedy during our stay but you do need your room key to access the elevator and to get into the pool and fitness room. The location was prime- a couple of blocks from the Pitt Street Mall, around the corner from a cinema and a Woolworth's with a grocery store. It was walking distance to the Harbourside entertainment area with the Aquarium, Imax, shopping mall and restaurants. You could walk to the Opera House or take a taxi for $7.00. A bus to Circular Quay was $1.40 per person one way. I found the staff to be helpful and cordial. They stored our luggage for us and granted us a late check-out. All in all, we were very pleased with this apartment and felt that it was an exceptional value. Next store to the hotel is a very tempting cupcake bakery. The cupcakes are creatively decorated and look very appetizing. Be warned- they look better than they taste and are expensive- 6 for $20.00

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great views”
Reviews.Author: OriginalScreenName
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and fantastic views from the 47th floor 2-bed, 2-bathroom apartment. We were prepared to wait a while for the lifts (having read previous reviews) but this was never an issue during our 4 night stay - even though only 2 of the 3 lifts ever appeared to be in service. ALL staff we dealt with were polite and friendly, and also helpful. Maybe their patience runs a bit thin on occasions with certain categories of guest who seem to demand immediate action to trivial requests. Who could blame them... Great value for money; apartment very well equipped and much better than staying in a hotel. Must admit that rooms, especially bathrooms, a tad chilly on those cool Sydney winter mornings - but at least it stopped my wife and daughters from spending hours in the bathroom each morning! HH London, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartment”
Reviews.Author: pag63
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment for 5 nights. The apartment was well equiped, very clean and was serviced every day. There is a pool and gym but we didn't use them. The location is handy to Townhall train station. It is a short walk to the Queen Victoria Building which has some nice shops. A 15 minute walk will take you to both Circular Quay or Darling Harbour. A much better option for my family (2 adults and 2 children aged 12 and 8) than a hotel room - much more space and the convenience of fully equiped kitchen and laundry room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Shame About the Attitude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in a one bedroom appartment and although the decor was good and the location fantastic, by the end we were tired of creeping around for fear of breaking a glass. Our experience was: - The receptionist was disinterested and unfriendly. As noted by other reviewers, she did not point out the $100 penalty if dishes were left unwashed upon checkout. We rang to request blankets as only thin duvets were provided (during winter) and were told: "I will see what I can do". - Rooms were not serviced on the Saturday until 2.30pm and at 1pm on Sunday. When I rang reception on Saturday to point out that the room was not yet cleaned, she explained that housekeeping were very busy. No apology. A very matter-of-fact, like it or lump it attitude. - One small pot was provided for cooking, no microwave cookware, and only one breakfast bowl for a two person room. - Warning notices were posted in the room, one in the hotel directory and one in the elevator warning that guests creating excessive noise would be ejected, without warning or refund. Another warning notice posted on the balcony door said police would be summoned if anything was thrown from the balcony. OK, fair enough, but there is firm language and threatening language and treating people as paying guests, rather than troublesome hooligans (no guests looked even slightly rowdy!) - I am used to the sound of aircon, but this one was extremely noisy and had to be turned off at night. - Oh, and the balcony was too small for more than one chair (dragged from the kitchen) and locks on both balconies didn't work - a concern for those with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Super place”
Reviews.Author: ACEFortLauderdale
