Reviews.Content: Loved this apt. Got a 3/3 on 47 floor corner unit with views to die for. Very well equiped, euro kitchen etc. We loved the place and the space provided. Close to shopping. Yes the elevevators were slow but just plan accordingly. Make sure you bring your paperwork to show booking or you could be out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the potential to be good with a good location and some good views from the top of the hotel apart from the incredibly rude staff and frustrating lifts. The lifts would take on average ten minutes and even longer during peak time to arrive. The staff rudeness wasnt a one off or one person experience with all of the staff actively going out of there way to be rude and seeminlgy to most of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with excellent view”
Reviews.Author: tky
Reviews.Content: Two of us booked a studio for two nights and when we got there they upgraded us. Little did we know they actually upgraded us to a 3 bedroom apartment! The apartment was very spacious, clean and comfortable. We stayed at one of the top floors, the view was breathtaking and sunlight filled every corner. Highly recommended and our only regret is not staying longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great suite!”
Reviews.Author: 250gilly
Reviews.Content: I searched everywhere to find a 2 bedroom suite suitable for 2 adult couples - both with King beds. I found a website called M-Power ( --). You submit your requirements and they come up with a hotel to match your request. I put in our requirements and they came up with Meriton Rialto Apartments. The suite was perfect for 2 adult couples. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, full kitchen, laundry facilities, access to pool, spa and gym, and close to Woolworths and right in the City centre. We were on the 40th floor with a balcony. Highly recommend the Meriton. Definately value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment”
Reviews.Author: Tiffer999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Rialto Apartments Sydney in January 2006;we arrived at 7 am with a book in time of 2 pm. The member of staff dealing with our booking informed us that our room was still occupied and would not be ready until 2 pm. She then did everything she could to find us an alternative apartment, which she duly did, and we got into our room before 8 am, very helpful staff through out our stay. The questions highlighted by other reviewers on the length of time it could take to get a lift. We have to say we found them ok never had to wait more than 1 to 2 minutes. The only exception to this was when we booked out, our friends had to wait about 9 minutes. They have an excellent security system in that you can only enter the apartments at night by using your room key, which has a security tab on it, which you use to gain access to the apartments lobby, you also have to use the same fob to gain access to your floor when using the lift (added security). The apartments are of a very high standard well equipped and tastefully decorated, the bedrooms were both of a high standard king size beds in both rooms, rooms with double beds in both rooms are very hard to find in Sydney and Australia in general (well it was for us) the master bed room had on suite facilities, and the other bedroom had a separate bathroom / shower room with easy access off the main room. The kitchen facilities were of good quality, which we used for our breakfast daily. The apartments laundry facilities included a washer and tumble dryer and also a dishwasher. The view from our window / balcony was over the city could have been better, but having said that we didnâ€™t go to Sydney to sit our apartment. Would not hesitate in using these apartments again or recommend these apartments to anyone who is looking for an apartment rather than a hotel whilst in Sydney. The location gave us easy access to all parts of Sydney, which we wanted to visit, all locations are within walk distance or short taxi rides, which are reasonable, priced. One tip it can take a long time during rush hour in a taxi so we would recommend that you walk at these times.

Reviews.Title: “Rave about the Rialto”
Reviews.Author: BigTaps
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great week in Sydney. 5 of us in the family including 3 boys (14, 10 & 4) Yes, believe the reviews - this is an excellent place to stay. The location is perfect. As many shops, including convenience stores and Woolworths, than you could ever need as soon as you step out of the building. 15 minutes to Darling Habour and 20 minutes walk to Circular Quay. We were in a very cllean 3 bedroomed apartment on the 42nd floor with great views. The accomodation is brilliant, fully equiped, cable TV, CD player the lot - even a washing machine and tumble drier much to my wifes delight! The beds were made up every day and the a full clean of the place twice a week. The indoor pool and spa pool were clean and the gym looked great. The staff were extremely pleasant and efficient, overall just a great place to stay for much less than you could stay in a Hotel of a similar standard.

Reviews.Title: “remarkable rialto”
Reviews.Author: KAM1703
Reviews.Content: spacious accommodation, central location, excellent views of the harbour bridge from our 44th floor, 3 bed apartment! polite, friendly and professional staff who were willing to help excellent value for money OK the lifts are a bit slow at peak times but everything else outweighed this slight inconvenience would definitely stay again highly recommed it

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC TRIP”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_townsville
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney to celebrate my 21st birthday and booked in at the meriton rialto. I had the best experience there with fantasic views (34th floor) in my 2 bedroom apartment. it was spacious, clean and nicely furnished. I was having drinks in my apartment and was concerned that i wouldnt be able to get my guests in... this was not a worry at all. i ended up with 15 in my room for some drinks before heading out into town. It was the best time and definitely a great location and so close to the clubs and bars i frequent. would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in 2 bedroom apartment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In response to the last couple of reviews slagging this place off I thought I should post our experience. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment which we got for a really good value rate. The apartments are very newly decorated/modern and our apartment on the 43rd floor had a nice view out towards Darling Harbour and beyond to I presume some of Sydneys suburbs. The 2 bedroom apartment had two bathrooms (one en-suite) and pretty much a full kitchen. For some reason our apartment didn't have stuff like a frying pan but when we contacted reception they brought it up promptly. The location of the Rialto is superb. Five mins from Darling Harbour and about two minutes from the Queen Victoria arcade and the start of Sydneys very impressive shopping district. 15/20 minutes gets you to the Opera House. The staff were fine although we only needed them to open the luggage storage room really. There are very prominently displayed signs describing the No-Party policy. This policy must also be signed at checkin. We got the impression that there is a problem with some rowdy guests causing hassles on weekends . Other signs warn that some of the balconies are locked as previous guests have been throwing stuff off them ! We noticed that on Saturday night there were a few people getting into lifts who looked the worse for wear. Sun/Mon nights were totally quiet.. The only complaints I had were that the lifts are pretty busy at weekend which made getting down to the local bottleshop a bit of a pain. I would absolutely not hesitate to stay in these apartments again. They are outstanding value if you get a last minute deal.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gwwyjjliu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a 1 bedroom apt. for 3 nights. Two major problems: 1) the lifts are the worst I've ever experienced in any building. I cannot believe that in a 54 story highrise they only have 3 elevators, and the programming and scheduling of them is completely illogical. One morning, we waited over 20 minutes just to get to the lobby as two lifts were parked on the lobby while the other was packed with guests and luggage coming down for check-out. 2) our room was infested with dozens of Bogon moths flying about. The staff said they were migrating and take refuge in any high-rise, which may be true, but they said nothing could be done. There must be a hole in our room somewhere, because we would finish getting rid of them (I killed over 30 moths one night) and the next morning they were back, flying everywhere and invading our luggage, bedding, toiletries, and food. It made our stay VERY UNPLEASANT. I'm sure other hotels had much better means of dealing with them than the Meriton Rialto. Other than those two problems, the hotel is in a good location, close to Darling Harbour and in a great shopping district. But, I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in other apartments in the city on our short breaks away, then we discovered this place. The location is great, close to the heart of Sydney shopping. We found the service friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Appauling Manager”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The night shift supervisor was appauling. He was rude, arrogant and partonising. Ruined our stay completely!! Would not recommend to anyone to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Don't ever book this place! Worse service in Australia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a night at the Meriton Rialto appartments in Sydney, and had possibly the worst experience ever at a hotel/appartment. The security/even manager there was extremely RUDE and RACIST! 3 minutes after some of us in the appartment had a cheer about something funny. The security/even manager, came knocking on our door, insisted one of the other appartments complained about us being too noisy and told us all pack up an leave imediately, and no warning was given. It takes more than 3 minutes to get from the lobby to our floor. NO warning was given and he refused to show us any paperwork on the policies. I have never experienced such disturbing rudness and racism in the hospitality industry any where around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Meriton Rialto - Great apts”
Reviews.Author: Twig
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton Rialto apts for 3 nights. We had a 2 bedroom apartment, which had 2 bathrooms, living room/dining room, kitchen, balcony and laundry. The apartment was cleaned every day and the decor was very clean and modern. There was a large indoor swimming pool and free internet access. The apartments are ideally located, 15 minute walk through the shops or the park to the bridge/ Opera house area and 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. Also very close to the monorail. Overall very good base for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views, easy access, great way to visit Sydney in style”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay in the luxury Meriton Rialto Apartments. The three bedroom apartment was spacious and would be the perfect size for a family. The location is great within walking distance of Pitt Street Mall and the Sydney Skytower and the Woolworths supermarket. The service from the desk staff was excellent and a perfect stay all round. FIVE STAR service for much less than a five star price.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: nickam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a 3 bedroomed apartment for 5 days having booked it from the UK. The deal was exceptionally good and the view from floor 41 was stunning, especially at night, looking across to the Sydney Tower. We might have felt differently on a lower floor but this aspect was the most striking aspect of our stay. Facilities were excellent in the apartment and seemed entirely new. The pool and gym were situated on a middle floor and easy to get to. The position of the hotel was ideal for the central shopping area. There did not appear to be a large staff but they were all pleasant and helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Meriton Serviced Apartments Pitt Street
HotelInfo.Address: 329 Pitt Street | Corner Pitt and Bathurst Streets, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
